#separator:Pipe

#deck:CSS properties (typed)
#notetype:type-in
#columns:front|back|url|extra_info|formal_definition|syntax|see_also|tag
#tags column:8
"Allows limiting of the contents of a block container to the specified number of lines"|-webkit-line-clamp|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp|<br>It only works in combination with the display property set to -webkit-box or -webkit-inline-box and the -webkit-box-orient property set to vertical<br>In most cases you will also want to set overflow to hidden, otherwise the contents won't be clipped but an ellipsis will still be shown after the specified number of lines<br>When applied to anchor elements, the truncating can happen in the middle of the text, not necessarily at the end<br><br>Note: This property was originally implemented in WebKit and has some issues It got standardized for legacy support The CSS Overflow Module Level 3 specification also defines a line-clamp property, which is meant to replace this property and avoid its issues|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>-webkit-line-clamp: none;<br><br>/* <integer> values */<br>-webkit-line-clamp: 3;<br>-webkit-line-clamp: 10;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>-webkit-line-clamp: inherit;<br>-webkit-line-clamp: initial;<br>-webkit-line-clamp: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><dl><br><dt id=""none""><code>none</code></dt><br><dd><br><p>This value specifies that the content won't be clamped.</p><br></dd><br><dt id=""integer""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/integer""><code>&lt;integer&gt;</code></a></dt><br><dd><br><p>This value specifies the number of lines after which the content will be clamped. It must be greater than 0.</p><br></dd><br></dl>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/line-clampin/"" rel=""noopener"">Line Clampin' (Truncating Multiple Line Text)</a></li><br><li><a class=""page-not-created"" title=""The documentation about this has not yet been written; please consider contributing!""><code>line-clamp</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-overflow
"Specifies the width of the stroke for text"|-webkit-text-stroke-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-text-stroke-width||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>absolute <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: thin;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: medium;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: thick;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: 2px;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: 0.1em;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: 1mm;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: 5pt;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: inherit;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: initial;<br>-webkit-text-stroke-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://webkit.org/blog/85/introducing-text-stroke/"" rel=""noopener"">Surfin' Safari blog post announcing this feature</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/adding-stroke-to-web-text/"" rel=""noopener"">CSS-Tricks article explaining this feature</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-text-stroke-color""><code>-webkit-text-stroke-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-text-stroke""><code>-webkit-text-stroke</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-text-fill-color""><code>-webkit-text-fill-color</code></a></li><br></ul>|compatibility
"Sets the accent color for user-interface controls generated by some elements"|accent-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/accent-color|<br>Browsers that support accent-color currently apply it to the following HTML elements:<br><input type=""checkbox""><br><input type=""radio""><br><input type=""range""><br><progress>|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td><code>auto</code> is computed as specified and <code>&lt;color&gt;</code> values are computed as defined for the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color""><code>color</code></a> property.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>accent-color: auto;<br><br>/* <color> values */<br>accent-color: darkred;<br>accent-color: #5729e9;<br>accent-color: rgb(0, 200, 0);<br>accent-color: hsl(228, 4%, 24%);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>accent-color: inherit;<br>accent-color: initial;<br>accent-color: revert;<br>accent-color: revert-layer;<br>accent-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input""><code>&lt;input&gt;</code></a> element</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Colors/Applying_color"">Applying color to HTML elements using CSS</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> data type</li><br><li>Other color-related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color""><code>color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow""><code>text-shadow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/caret-color""><code>caret-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-rule-color""><code>column-rule-color</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-ui
"Sets the distribution of space between and around content items along a flexbox's cross-axis or a grid's block axis"|align-content|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-content|<br>The interactive example below uses Grid Layout to demonstrate some of the values of this property<br>This property has no effect on single line flex containers (ie ones with flex-wrap: nowrap)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>multi-line flex containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Basic positional alignment */<br>/* align-content does not take left and right values */<br>align-content: center;     /* Pack items around the center */<br>align-content: start;      /* Pack items from the start */<br>align-content: end;        /* Pack items from the end */<br>align-content: flex-start; /* Pack flex items from the start */<br>align-content: flex-end;   /* Pack flex items from the end */<br><br>/* Normal alignment */<br>align-content: normal;<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>align-content: baseline;<br>align-content: first baseline;<br>align-content: last baseline;<br><br>/* Distributed alignment */<br>align-content: space-between; /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                 The first item is flush with the start,<br>                                 the last is flush with the end */<br>align-content: space-around;  /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                 Items have a half-size space<br>                                 on either end */<br>align-content: space-evenly;  /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                 Items have equal space around them */<br>align-content: stretch;       /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                 Stretch 'auto'-sized items to fit<br>                                 the container */<br><br>/* Overflow alignment */<br>align-content: safe center;<br>align-content: unsafe center;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>align-content: inherit;<br>align-content: initial;<br>align-content: revert;<br>align-content: revert-layer;<br>align-content: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Aligning_Items_in_a_Flex_Container"">Aligning items in a flex container</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br></ul>|css-align
"Sets the align-self value on all direct children as a group"|align-items|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items| In Flexbox, it controls the alignment of items on the Cross Axis In Grid Layout, it controls the alignment of items on the Block Axis within their grid area<br>The interactive example below demonstrates some of the values for align-items using grid layout|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Basic keywords */<br>align-items: normal;<br>align-items: stretch;<br><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>/* align-items does not take left and right values */<br>align-items: center; /* Pack items around the center */<br>align-items: start; /* Pack items from the start */<br>align-items: end; /* Pack items from the end */<br>align-items: flex-start; /* Pack flex items from the start */<br>align-items: flex-end; /* Pack flex items from the end */<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>align-items: baseline;<br>align-items: first baseline;<br>align-items: last baseline; /* Overflow alignment (for positional alignment only) */<br>align-items: safe center;<br>align-items: unsafe center;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>align-items: inherit;<br>align-items: initial;<br>align-items: revert;<br>align-items: revert-layer;<br>align-items: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Aligning_Items_in_a_Flex_Container"">Aligning items in a flex container</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-self""><code>align-self</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-align
"Overrides a grid or flex item's align-items value"|align-self|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-self| In Grid, it aligns the item inside the grid area In Flexbox, it aligns the item on the cross axis<br>The property doesn't apply to block-level boxes, or to table cells If a flexbox item's cross-axis margin is auto, then align-self is ignored|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex items, grid items, and absolutely-positioned boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td><code>auto</code> computes to itself on absolutely-positioned elements, and to the computed value of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items""><code>align-items</code></a> on the parent (minus any legacy keywords) on all other boxes, or <code>start</code> if the box has no parent. Its behavior depends on the layout model, as described for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-self""><code>justify-self</code></a>. Otherwise the specified value.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>align-self: auto;<br>align-self: normal;<br><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>/* align-self does not take left and right values */<br>align-self: center; /* Put the item around the center */<br>align-self: start; /* Put the item at the start */<br>align-self: end; /* Put the item at the end */<br>align-self: self-start; /* Align the item flush at the start */<br>align-self: self-end; /* Align the item flush at the end */<br>align-self: flex-start; /* Put the flex item at the start */<br>align-self: flex-end; /* Put the flex item at the end */<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>align-self: baseline;<br>align-self: first baseline;<br>align-self: last baseline;<br>align-self: stretch; /* Stretch 'auto'-sized items to fit the container */<br><br>/* Overflow alignment */<br>align-self: safe center;<br>align-self: unsafe center;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>align-self: inherit;<br>align-self: initial;<br>align-self: revert;<br>align-self: revert-layer;<br>align-self: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Aligning_Items_in_a_Flex_Container"">Aligning items in a flex container</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items""><code>align-items</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-align
"Resets all of an element's properties except unicode-bidi, direction, and CSS Custom Properties"|all|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/all| It can set properties to their initial or inherited values, or to the values specified in another cascade layer or stylesheet origin|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>There is no practical initial value for it.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as the specified value applies to each property this is a shorthand for.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand (all properties but <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/unicode-bidi""><code>unicode-bidi</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>)</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Global values */<br>all: initial;<br>all: inherit;<br>all: unset;<br>all: revert;<br>all: revert-layer;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>all</code> property is specified as one of the CSS global keyword values. Note that none of these values affect the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/unicode-bidi""><code>unicode-bidi</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a> properties.</p>|<p>CSS global keyword values: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial""><code>initial</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inherit""><code>inherit</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/unset""><code>unset</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/revert""><code>revert</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/revert-layer""><code>revert-layer</code></a></p>|css-cascade
"Applies an animation between styles"|animation|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation| It is a shorthand for animation-name, animation-duration, animation-timing-function, animation-delay, animation-iteration-count, animation-direction, animation-fill-mode, and animation-play-state<br>A description of which properties are animatable is available; it's worth noting that this description is also valid for CSS transitions|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-name""><code>animation-name</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-duration""><code>animation-duration</code></a>: <code>0s</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-timing-function""><code>animation-timing-function</code></a>: <code>ease</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-delay""><code>animation-delay</code></a>: <code>0s</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-iteration-count""><code>animation-iteration-count</code></a>: <code>1</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-direction""><code>animation-direction</code></a>: <code>normal</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-fill-mode""><code>animation-fill-mode</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-play-state""><code>animation-play-state</code></a>: <code>running</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-timeline""><code>animation-timeline</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::before""><code>::before</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::after""><code>::after</code></a> <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Pseudo-elements"">pseudo-elements</a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-name""><code>animation-name</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-duration""><code>animation-duration</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-timing-function""><code>animation-timing-function</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-delay""><code>animation-delay</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-direction""><code>animation-direction</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-iteration-count""><code>animation-iteration-count</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-fill-mode""><code>animation-fill-mode</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-play-state""><code>animation-play-state</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-timeline""><code>animation-timeline</code></a>: listEachItemIdentifyerOrNoneAuto</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>Not animatable</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* @keyframes duration | easing-function | delay |<br>iteration-count | direction | fill-mode | play-state | name */<br>animation: 3s ease-in 1s 2 reverse both paused slidein;<br><br>/* @keyframes duration | easing-function | delay | name */<br>animation: 3s linear 1s slidein;<br><br>/* two animations */<br>animation: 3s linear slidein, 3s ease-out 5s slideout;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>animation</code> property is specified as one or more single animations, separated by commas.</p><br><p>Each individual animation is specified as:</p><br><ul><br><li>zero, one, or two occurrences of the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/time""><code>&lt;time&gt;</code></a> value</li><br><li>zero or one occurrences of the following values:<br>    <ul><br><li><a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation#single-easing-function""><code>&lt;single-easing-function&gt;</code></a></li><br><li><a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation#single-animation-iteration-count""><code>&lt;single-animation-iteration-count&gt;</code></a></li><br><li><a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation#single-animation-direction""><code>&lt;single-animation-direction&gt;</code></a></li><br><li><a aria-current=""page"" animatable</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>animation-timing-function: ease;<br>animation-timing-function: ease-in;<br>animation-timing-function: ease-out;<br>animation-timing-function: ease-in-out;<br>animation-timing-function: linear;<br>animation-timing-function: step-start;<br>animation-timing-function: step-end;<br><br>/* Function values jump-start);<br>animation-timing-function: steps(10, jump-end);<br>animation-timing-function: steps(20, jump-none);<br>animation-timing-function: steps(5, jump-both);<br>animation-timing-function: steps(6, start);<br>animation-timing-function: steps(8, end);<br><br>/* Multiple animations */<br>animation-timing-function: ease, step-start, cubic-bezier(0.1, 0.7, 1, 0.1);<br><br>/* Global values unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><div class=""notecard note"" id=""sect1""><br><p><strong>Note:</strong> When you specify multiple comma-separated values on an <code>animation-*</code> property, they are applied to the animations in the order in which the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-name""><code>animation-name</code></a>s appear. For situations where the number of animations and <code>animation-*</code> property values do not match, see <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Animations/Using_CSS_animations#setting_multiple_animation_property_values"">Setting multiple animation property values</a>.</p><br></div>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Animations/Using_CSS_animations"">Using CSS animations</a></li><br><li><a "Is used to control native appearance of UI controls, that are based on operating system's theme"|appearance|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/appearance|<br>Before standardization this property allowed simple elements to be shown as widgets, such as buttons or check boxes It was considered a misfeature and authors are encouraged to use only standard keywords now<br>Note: If you wish to use this property on websites, you should test it very carefully Although it is supported in most modern browsers, its implementation varies In older browsers, even the keyword none does not have the same effect on all form elements across different browsers, and some do not support it at all The differences are smaller in the newest browsers|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th "Lets you apply graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element"|backdrop-filter|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter| Because it applies to everything behind the element, to see the effect you must make the element or its background at least partially transparent|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter#interpolation"" title=""If both filters have a function list of same length without URL, each of their filters functions is interpolated according to its specific rules. If they have different lengths, the missing equivalent filter functions from the longer list are added to the end of the shorter list using their default values, then all filter functions are interpolated according to their specific rules. If one filter is 'none', it is replaced with the filter functions list of the other one using the filter function default values, then all filter functions are interpolated according to their specific rules. Otherwise discrete interpolation is used."">filter function list</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>backdrop-filter: none;<br><br>/* URL to SVG filter */<br>backdrop-filter: url(commonfilters.svg#filter);<br><br>/* <filter-function> values */<br>backdrop-filter: blur(2px);<br>backdrop-filter: brightness(60%);<br>backdrop-filter: contrast(40%);<br>backdrop-filter: drop-shadow(4px 4px 10px blue);<br>backdrop-filter: grayscale(30%);<br>backdrop-filter: hue-rotate(120deg);<br>backdrop-filter: invert(70%);<br>backdrop-filter: opacity(20%);<br>backdrop-filter: sepia(90%);<br>backdrop-filter: saturate(80%);<br><br>/* Multiple filters */<br>backdrop-filter: url(filters.svg#filter) blur(4px) saturate(150%);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>backdrop-filter: inherit;<br>backdrop-filter: initial;<br>backdrop-filter: revert;<br>backdrop-filter: revert-layer;<br>backdrop-filter: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter""><code>filter</code></a></li><br></ul>|filter-effects-2
"Sets whether the back face of an element is visible when turned towards the user"|backface-visibility|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backface-visibility|<br>An element's back face is a mirror image of its front face Though invisible in 2D, the back face can become visible when a transformation causes the element to be rotated in 3D space (This property has no effect on 2D transforms, which have no perspective)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>visible</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>backface-visibility: visible;<br>backface-visibility: hidden;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>backface-visibility: inherit;<br>backface-visibility: initial;<br>backface-visibility: revert;<br>backface-visibility: revert-layer;<br>backface-visibility: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>backface-visibility</code> property is specified as one of the keywords listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Transforms/Using_CSS_transforms"">Using CSS transforms</a></li><br></ul>|css-transforms-2
"Sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method"|background|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-image""><code>background-image</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position""><code>background-position</code></a>: <code>0% 0%</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size""><code>background-size</code></a>: <code>auto auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-repeat""><code>background-repeat</code></a>: <code>repeat</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-origin""><code>background-origin</code></a>: <code>padding-box</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-clip""><code>background-clip</code></a>: <code>border-box</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment""><code>background-attachment</code></a>: <code>scroll</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>: <code>transparent</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. length and a percentage, plus an origin keyword</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position-y""><code>background-position-y</code></a>: A list, each item consisting of: an offset given as a combination of an absolute length and a percentage, plus an origin keyword</li></ul></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size""><code>background-size</code></a>: as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-origin""><code>background-origin</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-clip""><code>background-clip</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment""><code>background-attachment</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>: computed color</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-image""><code>background-image</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-clip""><code>background-clip</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position""><code>background-position</code></a>: repeatable list of simple list of length, percentage, or calc</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-repeat""><code>background-repeat</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a <background-color> */<br>background: green;<br><br>/* Using a <bg-image> and <repeat-style> */<br>background: url(""test.jpg"") repeat-y;<br><br>/* Using a <box> and <background-color> */<br>background: border-box red;<br><br>/* A single image, centered and scaled */<br>background: no-repeat center/80% url(""../img/image.png"");<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background: inherit;<br>background: initial;<br>background: revert;<br>background: revert-layer;<br>background: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>background</code> property is specified as one or more background layers, separated by commas.</p><br><p>The syntax of each layer is as follows:</p><br><ul><br><li>Each layer may include zero or one occurrences of any of the following values:<br>    <ul><br><li><code>&lt;attachment&gt;</code></li><br><li><code>&lt;bg-image&gt;</code></li><br><li><code>&lt;position&gt;</code></li><br><li><code>&lt;bg-size&gt;</code></li><br><li><code>&lt;repeat-style&gt;</code></li><br></ul><br></li><br><li>The <code>&lt;bg-size&gt;</code> value may only be included immediately after <code>&lt;position&gt;</code>, separated with the '/' character, like this: ""<code>center/80%</code>"".</li><br><li>The <code>&lt;box&gt;</code> value may be included zero, one, or two times. If included once, it sets both <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-origin""><code>background-origin</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-clip""><code>background-clip</code></a>. If it is included twice, the first occurrence sets <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-origin""><code>background-origin</code></a>, and the second sets <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-clip""><code>background-clip</code></a>.</li><br><li>The <code>&lt;background-color&gt;</code> value may only be included in the last layer specified.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-decoration-break""><code>box-decoration-break</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Images/Using_CSS_gradients"">Using gradients</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders/Using_multiple_backgrounds"">Using multiple backgrounds</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets whether a background image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls with its containing block"|background-attachment|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>scroll</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>background-attachment: scroll;<br>background-attachment: fixed;<br>background-attachment: local;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-attachment: inherit;<br>background-attachment: initial;<br>background-attachment: revert;<br>background-attachment: revert-layer;<br>background-attachment: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>background-attachment</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values from the list below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders/Using_multiple_backgrounds"">Using multiple backgrounds</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets how an element's background images should blend with each other and with the element's background color"|background-blend-mode|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-blend-mode|<br>Blending modes should be defined in the same order as the background-image property If the blending modes' and background images' list lengths are not equal, it will be repeated and/or truncated until lengths match|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements, graphics elements, and graphics referencing elements.. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* One value */<br>background-blend-mode: normal;<br><br>/* Two values, one per background */<br>background-blend-mode: darken, luminosity;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-blend-mode: inherit;<br>background-blend-mode: initial;<br>background-blend-mode: revert;<br>background-blend-mode: revert-layer;<br>background-blend-mode: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/blend-mode""><code>&lt;blend-mode&gt;</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mix-blend-mode""><code>mix-blend-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|compositing
"Sets whether an element's background extends underneath its border box, padding box, or content box"|background-clip|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-clip|<br>If the element has no background-image or background-color, this property will only have a visual effect when the border has transparent regions or partially opaque regions (due to border-style or border-image); otherwise, the border masks the difference<br>Note: Because the root element has a different background painting area, the background-clip property has no effect when specified on it See ""The backgrounds of special elements""<br>Note: For documents whose root element is an HTML element: if the computed value of background-image on the root element is none and its background-color is transparent, user agents must instead propagate the computed values of the background properties from that element's first HTML <body> child element The used values of that <body> element's background properties are their initial values, and the propagated values are treated as if they were specified on the root element It is recommended that authors of HTML documents specify the canvas background for the <body> element rather than the HTML element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>border-box</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>background-clip: border-box;<br>background-clip: padding-box;<br>background-clip: content-box;<br>background-clip: text;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-clip: inherit;<br>background-clip: initial;<br>background-clip: revert;<br>background-clip: revert-layer;<br>background-clip: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clip-path""><code>clip-path</code></a> property creates a clipping region that defines what part of an <em>entire element</em> should be displayed.</li><br><li>Background properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background""><code>background</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-image""><code>background-image</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-origin""><code>background-origin</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">Introduction to the CSS box model</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets the background color of an element"|background-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>transparent</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>background-color: red;<br>background-color: indigo;<br><br>/* Hexadecimal value */<br>background-color: #bbff00; /* Fully opaque */<br>background-color: #bf0; /* Fully opaque shorthand */<br>background-color: #11ffee00; /* Fully transparent */<br>background-color: #1fe0; /* Fully transparent shorthand */<br>background-color: #11ffeeff; /* Fully opaque */<br>background-color: #1fef; /* Fully opaque shorthand */<br><br>/* RGB value */<br>background-color: rgb(255, 255, 128); /* Fully opaque */<br>background-color: rgba(117, 190, 218, 0.5); /* 50% transparent */<br><br>/* HSL value */<br>background-color: hsl(50, 33%, 25%); /* Fully opaque */<br>background-color: hsla(<br>  50,<br>  33%,<br>  25%,<br>  0.75<br>); /* 75% opaque, i.e. 25% transparent */<br><br>/* Special keyword values */<br>background-color: currentcolor;<br>background-color: transparent;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-color: inherit;<br>background-color: initial;<br>background-color: revert;<br>background-color: revert-layer;<br>background-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>background-color</code> property is specified as a single <code>&lt;color&gt;</code> value.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders/Using_multiple_backgrounds"">Multiple backgrounds</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> data type</li><br><li>Other color-related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color""><code>color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-color""><code>text-emphasis-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow""><code>text-shadow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/caret-color""><code>caret-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-rule-color""><code>column-rule-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Colors/Applying_color"">Applying color to HTML elements using CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets one or more background images on an element"|background-image|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-image|<br>The background images are drawn on stacking context layers on top of each other The first layer specified is drawn as if it is closest to the user<br>The borders of the element are then drawn on top of them, and the background-color is drawn beneath them How the images are drawn relative to the box and its borders is defined by the background-clip and background-origin CSS properties<br>If a specified image cannot be drawn (for example, when the file denoted by the specified URI cannot be loaded), browsers handle it as they would a none value<br>Note: Even if the images are opaque and the color won't be displayed in normal circumstances, web developers should always specify a background-color If the images cannot be loadedfor instance, when the network is downthe background color will be used as a fallback|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/url""><code>url()</code></a> values made absolute</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>background-image: linear-gradient(<br>    to bottom,<br>    rgba(255, 255, 0, 0.5),<br>    rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.5)<br>  ), url(""catfront.png"");<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-image: inherit;<br>background-image: initial;<br>background-image: revert;<br>background-image: revert-layer;<br>background-image: unset;<br><br></pre><br><p>Each background image is specified either as the keyword <code>none</code> or as an <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/image""><code>&lt;image&gt;</code></a> value.</p><br><p>To specify multiple background images, supply multiple values, separated by a comma:</p><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Images/Implementing_image_sprites_in_CSS"">Implementing image sprites in CSS</a></li><br><li><a "Sets the background's origin: from the border start, inside the border, or inside the padding"|background-origin|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-origin|<br>Note that background-origin is ignored when background-attachment is fixed|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>padding-box</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Sets the initial position for each background image"|background-position|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position| The position is relative to the position layer set by background-origin|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0% 0%</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the size of the background positioning area minus size of background image; size refers to the width for horizontal offsets and to the height for vertical offsets</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a length and a percentage, plus an origin keyword</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position-y""><code>background-position-y</code></a>: A list, each item consisting of: an offset given as a combination of an absolute length and a percentage, plus an origin keyword</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>repeatable list of simple list of length, percentage, or calc</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>background-position: top;<br>background-position: bottom;<br>background-position: left;<br>background-position: right;<br>background-position: center;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>background-position: 25% 75%;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>background-position: 0 0;<br>background-position: 1cm 2cm;<br>background-position: 10ch 8em;<br><br>/* Multiple images */<br>background-position: 0 0, center;<br><br>/* Edge offsets values */<br>background-position: bottom 10px right 20px;<br>background-position: right 3em bottom 10px;<br>background-position: bottom 10px right;<br>background-position: top right 10px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-position: inherit;<br>background-position: initial;<br>background-position: revert;<br>background-position: revert-layer;<br>background-position: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>background-position</code> property is specified as one or more <code>&lt;position&gt;</code> values, separated by commas.</p>|<ul><br><li><a "Sets how background images are repeated"|background-repeat|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-repeat| A background image can be repeated along the horizontal and vertical axes, or not repeated at all<br>By default, the repeated images are clipped to the size of the element, but they can be scaled to fit (using round) or evenly distributed from end to end (using space)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>repeat</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>a list, each item consisting of two keywords, one per dimension</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>background-repeat: repeat-x;<br>background-repeat: repeat-y;<br>background-repeat: repeat;<br>background-repeat: space;<br>background-repeat: round;<br>background-repeat: no-repeat;<br><br>/* Two-value syntax: horizontal | vertical */<br>background-repeat: repeat space;<br>background-repeat: repeat repeat;<br>background-repeat: round space;<br>background-repeat: no-repeat round;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-repeat: inherit;<br>background-repeat: initial;<br>background-repeat: revert;<br>background-repeat: revert-layer;<br>background-repeat: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders/Using_multiple_backgrounds"">Using multiple backgrounds</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets the size of the element's background image"|background-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size|<br>  The image can be left to its natural size, stretched, or constrained to fit the available space<br><br>Spaces not covered by a background image are filled with the background-color property, and the background color will be visible behind background images that have transparency/translucency|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>relative to the background positioning area</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>repeatable list of simple list of length, percentage, or calc</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>background-size: cover;<br>background-size: contain;<br><br>/* One-value syntax */<br>/* the width of the image (height becomes 'auto') */<br>background-size: 50%;<br>background-size: 3.2em;<br>background-size: 12px;<br>background-size: auto;<br><br>/* Two-value syntax */<br>/* first value: width of the image, second value: height */<br>background-size: 50% auto;<br>background-size: 3em 25%;<br>background-size: auto 6px;<br>background-size: auto auto;<br><br>/* Multiple backgrounds */<br>background-size: auto, auto; /* Not to be confused with `auto auto` */<br>background-size: 50%, 25%, 25%;<br>background-size: 6px, auto, contain;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>background-size: inherit;<br>background-size: initial;<br>background-size: revert;<br>background-size: revert-layer;<br>background-size: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>background-size</code> property is specified in one of the following ways:</p><br><ul><br><li>Using the keyword values <code>contain</code> or <code>cover</code>.</li><br><li>Using a width value only, in which case the height defaults to <code>auto</code>.</li><br><li><br>    Using both a width and a height value, in which case the first sets the width and the second sets the height.<br>    Each value can be a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a>, a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a>, or <code>auto</code>.<br>  </li><br></ul><br><p>To specify the size of multiple background images, separate the value for each one with a comma.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders/Resizing_background_images"">Resizing background images</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Scaling_of_SVG_backgrounds"">Scaling of SVG backgrounds</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit""><code>object-fit</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode"|block-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/block-size| It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode<br>If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of block-size relates to the width of the element; otherwise, it relates to the height of the element A related property is inline-size, which defines the other dimension of the element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>block-size of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>block-size: 300px;<br>block-size: 25em;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>block-size: 75%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>block-size: max-content;<br>block-size: min-content;<br>block-size: fit-content(20em);<br>block-size: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>block-size: inherit;<br>block-size: initial;<br>block-size: revert;<br>block-size: revert-layer;<br>block-size: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical

The order of the values does not matter.</p><br><div class=""notecard note"" id=""sect1""><br><p><strong>Note:</strong> The border will be invisible if its style is not defined. This is because the style defaults to <code>none</code>.</p><br></div>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-width""><code>border-width</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-style""><code>border-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline""><code>outline</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders"">Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Backgrounds_and_borders"">Learn CSS: Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block border property values in a single place in the style sheet"|border-block|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block|<br>border-block can be used to set the values for one or more of border-block-width, border-block-style, and border-block-color setting both the start and end in the block dimension at once The physical borders to which it maps depends on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation It corresponds to the border-top and border-bottom or border-right, and border-left properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation<br>The borders in the other dimension can be set with border-inline, which sets border-inline-start, and border-inline-end|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: computed color</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-block: 1px;<br>border-block: 2px dotted;<br>border-block: medium dashed blue;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-block: inherit;<br>border-block: initial;<br>border-block: revert;<br>border-block: revert-layer;<br>border-block: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>This property maps to one of the physical border properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines the color of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|border-block-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-color| It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation<br>The border color in the other dimension can be set with border-inline-color which sets border-inline-start-color, and border-inline-end-color|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>currentcolor</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-block-color: yellow;<br>border-block-color: #f5f6f7;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-block-color: inherit;<br>border-block-color: initial;<br>border-block-color: revert;<br>border-block-color: revert-layer;<br>border-block-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>+ bug 1297097</li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet"|border-block-end|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: computed color</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-color""><code>border-block-end-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-style""><code>border-block-end-style</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-width""><code>border-block-end-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-block-end: 1px;<br>border-block-end: 2px dotted;<br>border-block-end: medium dashed blue;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-block-end: inherit;<br>border-block-end: initial;<br>border-block-end: revert;<br>border-block-end: revert-layer;<br>border-block-end: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p><code>border-block-end</code> can be used to set the values for one or more of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-width""><code>border-block-end-width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-style""><code>border-block-end-style</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-color""><code>border-block-end-color</code></a>. The physical border to which it maps depends on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a> property depending on the values defined for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>.</p><br><p>Related properties are <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start""><code>border-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-start""><code>border-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end""><code>border-inline-end</code></a>, which define the other borders of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>This property maps to one of the physical border properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical

"Defines the width of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|border-block-end-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-width| It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>medium</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>logical-width of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>absolute length;
