<a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-style""><code>border-block-start-style</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-width""><code>border-block-start-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-block-start: 1px;<br>border-block-start: 2px dotted;<br>border-block-start: medium dashed blue;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-block-start: inherit;<br>border-block-start: initial;<br>border-block-start: revert;<br>border-block-start: revert-layer;<br>border-block-start: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p><code>border-block-start</code> can be used to set the values for one or more of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-width""><code>border-block-start-width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-style""><code>border-block-start-style</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-color""><code>border-block-start-color</code></a>. The physical border to which it maps depends on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a> property depending on the values defined for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>.</p><br><p>Related properties are <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end""><code>border-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-start""><code>border-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end""><code>border-inline-end</code></a>, which define the other borders of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>This property maps to one of the physical border properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines the color of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|border-block-start-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-color| It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>currentcolor</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-block-start-color: blue;<br>border-block-start-color: #4c5d21;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-block-start-color: inherit;<br>border-block-start-color: initial;<br>border-block-start-color: revert;<br>border-block-start-color: revert-layer;<br>border-block-start-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>Related properties are <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-color""><code>border-block-end-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-start-color""><code>border-inline-start-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end-color""><code>border-inline-end-color</code></a>, which define the other border colors of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>This property maps to one of the physical border properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical

"Sets an element's bottom border"|border-bottom|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom| It sets the values of border-bottom-width, border-bottom-style and border-bottom-color<br>As with all shorthand properties, border-bottom always sets the values of all of the properties that it can set, even if they are not specified It sets those that are not specified to their default values Consider the following code:<br>border-bottom-style: dotted;<br>border-bottom: thick green;<br>It is actually the same as this one:<br>border-bottom-style: dotted;<br>border-bottom: none thick green;<br>The value of border-bottom-style given before border-bottom is ignored Since the default value of border-bottom-style is none, not specifying the border-style part results in no border|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style""><code>border-bottom-style</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style""><code>border-bottom-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style""><code>border-bottom-style</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>: computed color</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style""><code>border-bottom-style</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-bottom: 1px;<br>border-bottom: 2px dotted;<br>border-bottom: medium dashed blue;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-bottom: inherit;<br>border-bottom: initial;<br>border-bottom: revert;<br>border-bottom: revert-layer;<br>border-bottom: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The three values of the shorthand property can be specified in any order, and one or two of them may be omitted.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border""><code>border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block""><code>border-block</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline""><code>outline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets the color of an element's bottom border"|border-bottom-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color| It can also be set with the shorthand CSS properties border-color or border-bottom|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>currentcolor</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <color> values */<br>border-bottom-color: red;<br>border-bottom-color: #ffbb00;<br>border-bottom-color: rgb(255, 0, 0);<br>border-bottom-color: hsla(100%, 50%, 25%, 0.75);<br>border-bottom-color: currentcolor;<br>border-bottom-color: transparent;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-bottom-color: inherit;<br>border-bottom-color: initial;<br>border-bottom-color: revert;<br>border-bottom-color: revert-layer;<br>border-bottom-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-bottom-color</code> property is specified as a single value.</p>|<ul><br><li>The border-related CSS shorthand properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border""><code>border</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a>.</li><br><li>The color-related CSS properties for the other borders: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a>.</li><br><li>The other border-related CSS properties applying to the same border: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style""><code>border-bottom-style</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>.</li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Rounds the bottom-left corner of an element by specifying the radius (or the radius of the semi-major and semi-minor axes) of the ellipse defining the curvature of the corner"|border-bottom-left-radius|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-left-radius|<br>The rounding can be a circle or an ellipse, or if one of the value is 0 no rounding is done and the corner is square<br><br>A background, being an image or a color, is clipped at the border, even a rounded one; the exact location of the clipping is defined by the value of the background-clip property<br>Note: If the value of this property is not set in a border-radius shorthand property that is applied to the element after the border-bottom-left-radius CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; but User Agents are not required to apply to <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code> elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. The behavior on internal table elements is undefined for the moment.. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the corresponding dimension of the border box</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>two absolute <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a>s or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a>s</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* the corner is a circle */<br>/* border-bottom-left-radius: radius */<br>border-bottom-left-radius: 3px;<br><br>/* Percentage values */<br><br>/* circle if box is a square or ellipse if box is a rectangle */<br>border-bottom-left-radius: 20%;<br><br>/* same as above: 20% of horizontal(width) and vertical(height) */<br>border-bottom-left-radius: 20% 20%;<br><br>/* 20% of horizontal(width) and 10% of vertical(height) */<br>border-bottom-left-radius: 20% 10%;<br><br>/* the corner is an ellipse */<br>/* border-bottom-left-radius: horizontal vertical */<br>border-bottom-left-radius: 0.5em 1em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-bottom-left-radius: inherit;<br>border-bottom-left-radius: initial;<br>border-bottom-left-radius: revert;<br>border-bottom-left-radius: revert-layer;<br>border-bottom-left-radius: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>With one value:</p><br><ul><br><li>the value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a> denoting the radius of the circle to use for the border in that corner.</li><br></ul><br><p>With two values:</p><br><ul><br><li>the first value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a> denoting the horizontal semi-major axis of the ellipse to use for the border in that corner.</li><br><li>the second value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a> denoting the vertical semi-major axis of the ellipse to use for the border in that corner.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-radius""><code>border-radius</code></a> shorthand property</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-right-radius""><code>border-top-right-radius</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-right-radius""><code>border-bottom-right-radius</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-left-radius""><code>border-top-left-radius</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Rounds the bottom-right corner of an element by specifying the radius (or the radius of the semi-major and semi-minor axes) of the ellipse defining the curvature of the corner"|border-bottom-right-radius|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-right-radius|<br>The rounding can be a circle or an ellipse, or if one of the value is 0 no rounding is done and the corner is square<br><br>A background, being an image or a color, is clipped at the border, even a rounded one; the exact location of the clipping is defined by the value of the background-clip property<br>Note: If the value of this property is not set in a border-radius shorthand property that is applied to the element after the border-bottom-right-radius CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; but User Agents are not required to apply to <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code> elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. box</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>two absolute <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* The corner is a circle */<br>/* border-bottom-right-radius: radius */<br>border-bottom-right-radius: 3px;<br><br>/* horizontal(width) and vertical(height) */<br>border-bottom-right-radius: 20% 10%; /* 20% of horizontal(width) and 10% of vertical(height) */<br><br>/*The corner is an ellipse */<br>/* border-bottom-right-radius: horizontal vertical */<br>border-bottom-right-radius: 0.5em 1em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-bottom-right-radius: inherit;<br>border-bottom-right-radius: initial;<br>border-bottom-right-radius: revert;<br>border-bottom-right-radius: revert-layer;<br>border-bottom-right-radius: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>With one value:</p><br><ul><br><li>the value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a> denoting the radius of the circle to use for the border in that corner.</li><br></ul><br><p>With two values:</p><br><ul><br><li>the first value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a corner.</li><br><li>the second value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a> denoting the vertical semi-major axis of the ellipse to use for the border in that corner.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-radius""><code>border-radius</code></a> shorthand property</li><br><li><a "Sets the line style of an element's bottom border"|border-bottom-style|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style|<br>Note: The specification doesn't define how borders of different styles connect in the corners|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Sets whether cells inside a <table> have shared or separate borders"|border-collapse|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse|<br>When cells are collapsed, the border-style value of inset behaves like groove, and outset behaves like ridge<br>When cells are separated, the distance between cells is defined by the border-spacing property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>separate</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td><code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code> elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>border-collapse: collapse;<br>border-collapse: separate;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-collapse: inherit;<br>border-collapse: initial;<br>border-collapse: revert;<br>border-collapse: revert-layer;<br>border-collapse: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-collapse</code> property is specified as a single keyword, which may be chosen from the list below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-spacing""><code>border-spacing</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-style""><code>border-style</code></a></li><br><li>The <code>border-collapse</code> property alters the appearance of the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/table""><code>&lt;table&gt;</code></a> HTML element.</li><br></ul>|css2
"Sets the color of an element's border"|border-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color|<br>Each side can be set individually using border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, and border-left-color; or using the writing mode-aware border-block-start-color, border-block-end-color, border-inline-start-color, and border-inline-end-color<br>You can find more information about border colors in Borders in Applying color to HTML elements using CSS|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>: computed color</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a>: computed color</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>: computed color</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: computed color</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <color> values */<br>border-color: red;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>border-color: red #f015ca;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>border-color: red rgb(240, 30, 50, 0.7) green;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>border-color: red yellow green blue;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-color: inherit;<br>border-color: initial;<br>border-color: revert;<br>border-color: revert-layer;<br>border-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-color</code> property may be specified using one, two, three, or four values.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same color to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first color applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first color applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the colors apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>Border-color related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border""><code>border</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-width""><code>border-width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> data type</li><br><li>Other color-related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color""><code>color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>, <a "Defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation"|border-end-end-radius|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-end-end-radius| This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode<br>This property affects the corner between the block-end and the inline-end sides of the element For instance, in a horizontal-tb writing mode with ltr direction, it corresponds to the border-bottom-right-radius property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; but User Agents are not required to apply to <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code> elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. The behavior on internal table elements is undefined for the moment.. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the corresponding dimension of the border box</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>two absolute <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a>s or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a>s</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>/* With one value the corner will be a circle */<br>border-end-end-radius: 10px;<br>border-end-end-radius: 1em;<br><br>/* With two values the corner will be an ellipse */<br>border-end-end-radius: 1em 2em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-end-end-radius: inherit;<br>border-end-end-radius: initial;<br>border-end-end-radius: revert;<br>border-end-end-radius: revert-layer;<br>border-end-end-radius: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>The mapped physical property: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-right-radius""><code>border-bottom-right-radius</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation"|border-end-start-radius|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-end-start-radius| This is useful when building styles to work regardless of the text orientation and writing mode<br>This property affects the corner between the block-end and the inline-start sides of the element For instance, in a horizontal-tb writing mode with ltr direction, it corresponds to the border-bottom-left-radius property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; but User Agents are not required to apply to <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code> elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. "Draws an image around a given element"|border-image|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image| It replaces the element's regular border<br>Note: You should specify a separate border-style in case the border image fails to load Although the specification doesn't strictly require it, some browsers don't render the border image if border-style is none or border-width is 0|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-source""><code>border-image-source</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-slice""><code>border-image-slice</code></a>: <code>100%</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-width""><code>border-image-width</code></a>: <code>1</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-outset""><code>border-image-outset</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-repeat""><code>border-image-repeat</code></a>: <code>stretch</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except internal table elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-slice""><code>border-image-slice</code></a>: refer to the size of the border image</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-width""><code>border-image-width</code></a>: refer to the width or height of the border image area</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-outset""><code>border-image-outset</code></a>: as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-repeat""><code>border-image-repeat</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-slice""><code>border-image-slice</code></a>: one to four percentage(s) (as specified) or absolute length(s), plus the keyword <code>fill</code> if specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-source""><code>border-image-source</code></a>: <code>none</code> or the image with its URI made absolute</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-width""><code>border-image-width</code></a>: as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* source | slice */<br>border-image: linear-gradient(red, blue) 27;<br><br>/* source | slice | repeat */<br>border-image: url(""/images/border.png"") 27 space;<br><br>/* source | slice | width */<br>border-image: linear-gradient(red, blue) 27 / 35px;<br><br>/* source | slice | width | outset | repeat */<br>border-image: url(""/images/border.png"") 27 23 / 50px 30px / 1rem round space;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-image: inherit;<br>border-image: initial;<br>border-image: revert;<br>border-image: revert-layer;<br>border-image: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-image</code> property may be specified with anywhere from one to five of the values listed below.</p><br><div class=""notecard note"" id=""sect2""><br><p><strong>Note:</strong> If the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">computed value</a> of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-source""><code>border-image-source</code></a> is <code>none</code>, or if the image cannot be displayed, the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-style""><code>border-style</code></a> will be displayed instead.</p><br></div>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border""><code>border</code></a></li><br><li><a "Sets the distance by which an element's border image is set out from its border box"|border-image-outset|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-outset|<br>The parts of the border image that are rendered outside the element's border box with border-image-outset do not trigger overflow scrollbars and don't capture mouse events|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except internal table elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> value */<br>border-image-outset: 1rem;<br><br>/* <number> value */<br>border-image-outset: 1.5;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>border-image-outset: 1 1.2;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>border-image-outset: 30px 2 45px;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>border-image-outset: 7px 12px 14px 5px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-image-outset: inherit;<br>border-image-outset: initial;<br>border-image-outset: revert;<br>border-image-outset: revert-layer;<br>border-image-outset: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-image-outset</code> property may be specified as one, two, three, or four values. Each value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a>. Negative values are invalid and will cause the <code>border-image-outset</code> declaration to be ignored.</p><br><ol><br><li>If <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>If <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong> and the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>If <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>, and the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>If <strong>four</strong> values are specified, they apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ol>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders"">Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Backgrounds_and_borders"">Learn CSS: Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Defines how the edge regions and middle region of a source image are adjusted to fit the dimensions of an element's border image"|border-image-repeat|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-repeat| The middle region can be displayed by using the keyword ""fill"" in the border-image-slice property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>stretch</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except internal table elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>border-image-repeat: stretch;<br>border-image-repeat: repeat;<br>border-image-repeat: round;<br>border-image-repeat: space;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>border-image-repeat: round stretch;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-image-repeat: inherit;<br>border-image-repeat: initial;<br>border-image-repeat: revert;<br>border-image-repeat: revert-layer;<br>border-image-repeat: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-image-repeat</code> property may be specified using one or two values chosen from the list of values below.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same behavior on <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first applies to the <strong>top, middle, and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders"">Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Backgrounds_and_borders"">Learn CSS: Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Divides the image specified by border-image-source into regions"|border-image-slice|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-slice| These regions form the components of an element's border image<br>The slicing process creates nine regions in total: four corners, four edges, and a middle region Four slice lines, set a given distance from their respective sides, control the size of the regions<br><br>The above diagram illustrates the location of each region<br>Zones 1-4 are corner regions Each one is used a single time to form the corners of the final border image<br>Zones 5-8 are edge regions These are repeated, scaled, or otherwise modified in the final border image to match the dimensions of the element<br>Zone 9 is the middle region It is discarded by default, but is used like a background image if the keyword fill is set<br>The border-image-repeat, border-image-width, and border-image-outset properties determine how these regions are used to form the final border image|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>100%</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except internal table elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the size of the border image</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>one to four percentage(s) (as specified) or absolute length(s), plus the keyword <code>fill</code> if specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* All sides */<br>border-image-slice: 30%;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>border-image-slice: 10% 30%;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>border-image-slice: 30 30% 45;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>border-image-slice: 7 12 14 5;<br><br>/* Using the `fill` keyword */<br>border-image-slice: 10% fill 7 12;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-image-slice: inherit;<br>border-image-slice: initial;<br>border-image-slice: revert;<br>border-image-slice: revert-layer;<br>border-image-slice: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-image-slice</code> property may be specified using one to four <code>&lt;number-percentage&gt;</code> values to represent the position of each image slice. Negative values are invalid; values greater than their corresponding dimension are clamped to <code>100%</code>.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> position is specified, it creates all four slices at the same distance from their respective sides.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> positions are specified, the first value creates slices measured from the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second creates slices measured from the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> positions are specified, the first value creates a slice measured from the <strong>top</strong>, the second creates slices measured from the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third creates a slice measured from the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> positions are specified, they create slices measured from the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul><br><p>The optional <code>fill</code> value, if used, can be placed anywhere in the declaration.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Shorthand_properties#tricky_edge_cases"">Illustrated description of the 1-to-4-value syntax</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets the source image used to create an element's border image"|border-image-source|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-source|<br>The border-image-slice property is used to divide the source image into regions, which are then dynamically applied to the final border image|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except internal table elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td><code>none</code> or the image with its URI made absolute</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>border-image-source: none;<br><br>/* <image> values */<br>border-image-source: url(image.jpg);<br>border-image-source: linear-gradient(to top, red, yellow);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-image-source: inherit;<br>border-image-source: initial;<br>border-image-source: revert;<br>border-image-source: revert-layer;<br>border-image-source: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border""><code>border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline""><code>outline</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-shadow""><code>box-shadow</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-image""><code>background-image</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/url""><code>url()</code></a> function</li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets the width of an element's border image"|border-image-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-image-width|<br>If this property's value is greater than the element's border-width, the border image will extend beyond the padding (and/or content) edge|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>1</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except internal table elements when <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a> is <code>collapse</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width or height of the border image area</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>border-image-width: auto;<br><br>/* <length> value */<br>border-image-width: 1rem;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>border-image-width: 25%;<br><br>/* <number> value */<br>border-image-width: 3;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>border-image-width: 2em 3em;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>border-image-width: 5% 15% 10%;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>border-image-width: 5% 2em 10% auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-image-width: inherit;<br>border-image-width: initial;<br>border-image-width: revert;<br>border-image-width: revert-layer;<br>border-image-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-image-width</code> property may be specified using one, two, three, or four values chosen from the list of values below.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same width to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first width applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first width applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the widths apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Backgrounds_and_Borders"">Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Backgrounds_and_borders"">Learn CSS: Backgrounds and borders</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline border property values in a single place in the style sheet"|border-inline|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline|<br>The physical borders to which border-inline maps depends on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation It corresponds to the border-top and border-bottom or border-right, and border-left properties, depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation<br>The borders in the other dimension can be set with border-block, which sets border-block-start, and border-block-end|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end-color""><code>border-inline-end-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end-style""><code>border-inline-end-style</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end-width""><code>border-inline-end-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-inline-end: 1px;<br>border-inline-end: 2px dashed;<br>border-inline-end: medium dashed blue;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-inline-end: inherit;<br>border-inline-end: initial;<br>border-inline-end: revert;<br>border-inline-end: revert-layer;<br>border-inline-end: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The physical border to which <code>border-inline-end</code> maps depends on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a> property depending on the values defined for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>.</p><br><p>Related properties are <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start""><code>border-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end""><code>border-block-end</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-start""><code>border-inline-start</code></a>, which define the other borders of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>This property maps to one of the physical border properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top""><code>border-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right""><code>border-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom""><code>border-bottom</code></a>, or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left""><code>border-left</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines the color of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|border-inline-end-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end-color| It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>currentcolor</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. "Defines the color of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|border-inline-start-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-start-color| It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>currentcolor</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>border-inline-start-color: red;<br>border-inline-start-color: #ee4141;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-inline-start-color: inherit;<br>border-inline-start-color: initial;<br>border-inline-start-color: revert;<br>border-inline-start-color: revert-layer;<br>border-inline-start-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>Related properties are <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-start-color""><code>border-block-start-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-block-end-color""><code>border-block-end-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-inline-end-color""><code>border-inline-end-color</code></a>, which define the other border colors of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>This property maps to one of the physical border properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-color""><code>border-top-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-color""><code>border-right-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-color""><code>border-bottom-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-color""><code>border-left-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
