"Sets the width of an element's border"|border-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-width||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-width""><code>border-right-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-width""><code>border-left-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-style""><code>border-bottom-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-width""><code>border-left-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-style""><code>border-left-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-width""><code>border-right-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-style""><code>border-right-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: the absolute length or <code>0</code> if <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-style""><code>border-top-style</code></a> is <code>none</code> or <code>hidden</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-width""><code>border-left-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-width""><code>border-right-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>border-width: thin;<br>border-width: medium;<br>border-width: thick;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>border-width: 4px;<br>border-width: 1.2rem;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>border-width: 2px 1.5em;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>border-width: 1px 2em 1.5cm;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>border-width: 1px 2em 0 4rem;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>border-width: inherit;<br>border-width: initial;<br>border-width: revert;<br>border-width: revert-layer;<br>border-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>border-width</code> property may be specified using one, two, three, or four values.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same width to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first width applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first width applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the widths apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>The border-related shorthand properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border""><code>border</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-style""><code>border-style</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a></li><br><li>The border-width-related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width""><code>border-bottom-width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-left-width""><code>border-left-width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-right-width""><code>border-right-width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-top-width""><code>border-top-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Participates in setting the vertical position of a positioned element"|bottom|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom| It has no effect on non-positioned elements<br>The effect of bottom depends on how the element is positioned (ie, the value of the position property):<br>When position is set to absolute or fixed, the bottom property specifies the distance between the element's outer margin of bottom edge and the inner border of the bottom edge of its containing block<br>When position is set to relative, the bottom property specifies the distance the element's bottom edge is moved above its normal position<br>When position is set to sticky, the bottom property is used to compute the sticky-constraint rectangle<br>When position is set to static, the bottom property has no effect<br>When both top and bottom are specified, position is set to absolute or fixed, and height is unspecified (either auto or 100%) both the top and bottom distances are respected In all other situations, if height is constrained in any way or position is set to relative, the top property takes precedence and the bottom property is ignored|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>positioned elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the height of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>bottom: 3px;<br>bottom: 2.4em;<br><br>/* <percentage>s of the height of the containing block */<br>bottom: 10%;<br><br>/* Keyword value */<br>bottom: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>bottom: inherit;<br>bottom: initial;<br>bottom: revert;<br>bottom: revert-layer;<br>bottom: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset""><code>inset</code></a>, the shorthand for all related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/top""><code>top</code></a>, <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom""><code>bottom</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left""><code>left</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/right""><code>right</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block-start""><code>inset-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block-end""><code>inset-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline-start""><code>inset-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline-end""><code>inset-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block""><code>inset-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline""><code>inset-inline</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position""><code>position</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-position
"Specifies how an element's fragments should be rendered when broken across multiple lines, columns, or pages"|box-decoration-break|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-decoration-break|<br>The specified value will impact the appearance of the following properties:<br>background<br>border<br>border-image<br>box-shadow<br>clip-path<br>margin<br>padding|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>slice</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>box-decoration-break: slice;<br>box-decoration-break: clone;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>box-decoration-break: inherit;<br>box-decoration-break: initial;<br>box-decoration-break: revert;<br>box-decoration-break: revert-layer;<br>box-decoration-break: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>box-decoration-break</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/break-after""><code>break-after</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/break-before""><code>break-before</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/break-inside""><code>break-inside</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-break
"Adds shadow effects around an element's frame"|box-shadow|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-shadow| You can set multiple effects separated by commas A box shadow is described by X and Y offsets relative to the element, blur and spread radius, and color<br>The box-shadow property enables you to cast a drop shadow from the frame of almost any element If a border-radius is specified on the element with a box shadow, the box shadow takes on the same rounded corners The z-ordering of multiple box shadows is the same as multiple text shadows (the first specified shadow is on top)<br>Box-shadow generator is an interactive tool allowing you to generate a box-shadow|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>any length made absolute; any specified color computed; otherwise as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-shadow#Interpolation"" title=""The color, x, y, blur and spread (if applicable) components of shadow lists are interpolated independently. If the inset value of any shadow pair differs between both lists, the whole list is uninterpolable. If one list is smaller than the other, it gets padded with transparent shadows with all their lengths set to 0 and its inset value matching the longer list."">shadow list</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>box-shadow: none;<br><br>/* offset-x | offset-y | color */<br>box-shadow: 60px -16px teal;<br><br>/* offset-x | offset-y | blur-radius | color */<br>box-shadow: 10px 5px 5px black;<br><br>/* offset-x | offset-y | blur-radius | spread-radius | color */<br>box-shadow: 2px 2px 2px 1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);<br><br>/* inset | offset-x | offset-y | color */<br>box-shadow: inset 5em 1em gold;<br><br>/* Any number of shadows, separated by commas */<br>box-shadow: 3px 3px red, -1em 0 0.4em olive;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>box-shadow: inherit;<br>box-shadow: initial;<br>box-shadow: revert;<br>box-shadow: revert-layer;<br>box-shadow: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>Specify a single box-shadow using:</p><br><ul><br><li>Two, three, or four <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> values.<br>    <ul><br><li>If only two values are given, they are interpreted as <code>&lt;offset-x&gt;</code> and <code>&lt;offset-y&gt;</code> values.</li><br><li>If a third value is given, it is interpreted as a <code>&lt;blur-radius&gt;</code>.</li><br><li>If a fourth value is given, it is interpreted as a <code>&lt;spread-radius&gt;</code>.</li><br></ul><br></li><br><li>Optionally, the <code>inset</code> keyword.</li><br><li>Optionally, a <a href=""#color""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> value.</li><br></ul><br><p>To specify multiple shadows, provide a comma-separated list of shadows.</p>|<ul><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> data type (for specifying the shadow color)</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow""><code>text-shadow</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter-function/drop-shadow""><code>drop-shadow()</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Colors/Applying_color"">Applying color to HTML elements using CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-backgrounds
"Sets how the total width and height of an element is calculated"|box-sizing|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-sizing|<br>By default in the CSS box model, the width and height you assign to an element is applied only to the element's content box If the element has any border or padding, this is then added to the width and height to arrive at the size of the box that's rendered on the screen This means that when you set width and height, you have to adjust the value you give to allow for any border or padding that may be added For example, if you have four boxes with width: 25%;, if any has left or right padding or a left or right border, they will not by default fit on one line within the constraints of the parent container<br>The box-sizing property can be used to adjust this behavior:<br>content-box gives you the default CSS box-sizing behavior If you set an element's width to 100 pixels, then the element's content box will be 100 pixels wide, and the width of any border or padding will be added to the final rendered width, making the element wider than 100px<br><br>border-box tells the browser to account for any border and padding in the values you specify for an element's width and height If you set an element's width to 100 pixels, that 100 pixels will include any border or padding you added, and the content box will shrink to absorb that extra width This typically makes it much easier to size elements<br>    box-sizing: border-box is the default styling that browsers use for the <table>, <select>, and <button> elements, and for <input> elements whose type is radio, checkbox, reset, button, submit, color, or search<br>  <br>Note: It is often useful to set box-sizing to border-box to lay out elements This makes dealing with the sizes of elements much easier, and generally eliminates a number of pitfalls you can stumble on while laying out your content On the other hand, when using position: relative or position: absolute, use of box-sizing: content-box allows the positioning values to be relative to the content, and independent of changes to border and padding sizes, which is sometimes desirable|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>content-box</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements that accept width or height</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>box-sizing: border-box;<br>box-sizing: content-box;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>box-sizing: inherit;<br>box-sizing: initial;<br>box-sizing: revert;<br>box-sizing: revert-layer;<br>box-sizing: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>box-sizing</code> property is specified as a single keyword chosen from the list of values below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">CSS box model</a></li><br></ul>|css-sizing
"Puts the content of a table's <caption> on the specified side"|caption-side|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/caption-side| The values are relative to the writing-mode of the table|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>top</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>table-caption elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Directional values */<br>caption-side: top;<br>caption-side: bottom;<br><br>/* Logical values */<br>caption-side: block-start;<br>caption-side: block-end;<br>caption-side: inline-start;<br>caption-side: inline-end;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>caption-side: inherit;<br>caption-side: initial;<br>caption-side: revert;<br>caption-side: revert-layer;<br>caption-side: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>caption-side</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>||css-logical
"Sets the color of the insertion caret, the visible marker where the next character typed will be inserted"|caret-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/caret-color| This is sometimes referred to as the text input cursor The caret appears in elements such as <input> or those with the contenteditable attribute The caret is typically a thin vertical line that flashes to help make it more noticeable By default, it is black, but its color can be altered with this property<br>Note that the insertion caret is only one type of caret For example, many browsers have a ""navigation caret,"" which acts similarly to an insertion caret but can be moved around in non-editable text On the other hand, the mouse cursor image shown when hovering over text where the cursor property is auto, or when hovering over an element where the cursor property is text or vertical-text, though it sometimes looks like a caret, is not a caret (it's a cursor)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td><code>auto</code> is computed as specified and <code>&lt;color&gt;</code> values are computed as defined for the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color""><code>color</code></a> property.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values "Sets whether an element must be moved below (cleared) floating elements that precede it"|clear|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clear| The clear property applies to floating and non-floating elements<br>When applied to non-floating blocks, it moves the border edge of the element down until it is below the margin edge of all relevant floats The non-floated block's top margin collapses<br>Vertical margins between two floated elements on the other hand will not collapse When applied to floating elements, the margin edge of the bottom element is moved below the margin edge of all relevant floats This affects the position of later floats, since later floats cannot be positioned higher than earlier ones<br>The floats that are relevant to be cleared are the earlier floats within the same block formatting context<br>Note: If an element contains only floated elements, its height collapses to nothing If you want it to always be able to resize, so that it contains floating elements inside it, set the value of the element's display property to flow-root<br>#container {<br>  display: flow-root;<br>}|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a "Creates a clipping region that sets what part of an element should be shown"|clip-path|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clip-path| Parts that are inside the region are shown, while "Sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the currentcolor value"|color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color| currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color<br>For an overview of using color in HTML, see Applying color to HTML elements using CSS|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>canvastext</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements and text. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>color: currentcolor;<br><br>/* <named-color> values */<br>color: red;<br>color: orange;<br>color: tan;<br>color: rebeccapurple;<br><br>/* <hex-color> values */<br>color: #090;<br>color: #009900;<br>color: #090a;<br>color: #009900aa;<br><br>/* <rgb()> values */<br>color: rgb(34, 12, 64, 0.6);<br>color: rgba(34, 12, 64, 0.6);<br>color: rgb(34 12 64 / 0.6);<br>color: rgba(34 12 64 / 0.3);<br>color: rgb(34 12 64 / 60%);<br>color: rgba(34.6 12 64 / 30%);<br><br>/* <hsl()> values */<br>color: hsl(30, 100%, 50%, 0.6);<br>color: hsla(30, 100%, 50%, 0.6);<br>color: hsl(30 100% 50% / 0.6);<br>color: hsla(30 100% 50% / 0.6);<br>color: hsl(30 100% 50% / 60%);<br>color: hsla(30.2 100% 50% / 60%);<br><br>/* <hwb()> values */<br>color: hwb(90 10% 10%);<br>color: hwb(90 10% 10% / 0.5);<br>color: hwb(90deg 10% 10%);<br>color: hwb(1.5708rad 60% 0%);<br>color: hwb(0.25turn 0% 40% / 50%);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>color: inherit;<br>color: initial;<br>color: revert;<br>color: revert-layer;<br>color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>color</code> property is specified as a single <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> value.</p><br><p>Note that the value must be a uniform <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color""><code>color</code></a>. It can't be a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/gradient""><code>&lt;gradient&gt;</code></a>, which is actually a type of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/image""><code>&lt;image&gt;</code></a>.</p>|<ul><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> data type</li><br><li>Other color-related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-color""><code>text-emphasis-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow""><code>text-shadow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/caret-color""><code>caret-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-rule-color""><code>column-rule-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/print-color-adjust""><code>print-color-adjust</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Colors/Applying_color"">Applying color to HTML elements using CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-color
"Allows an element to indicate which color schemes it can comfortably be rendered in"|color-scheme|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color-scheme|<br>Common choices for operating system color schemes are ""light"" and ""dark"", or ""day mode"" and ""night mode"" When a user selects one of these color schemes, the operating system makes adjustments to the user interface This includes form controls, scrollbars, and the used values of CSS system colors|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements and "Sets the width of the line drawn between columns in a multi-column layout"|column-rule-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-rule-width||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>medium</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>multicol elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the absolute length; "Sets the ideal column width in a multi-column layout"|column-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-width| The container will have as many columns as can fit without any of them having a width less than the column-width value If the width of the container is narrower than the specified value, the single column's width will be smaller than the declared column width<br>This property can help you create responsive designs that fit different screen sizes Especially in the presence of the column-count property (which has precedence), you must specify all related length values to achieve an exact column width In horizontal text these are width, column-width, column-gap, and column-rule-width|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>Block containers except table wrapper boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the absolute length, zero or larger</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>column-width: auto;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>column-width: 60px;<br>column-width: 15.5em;<br>column-width: 3.3vw;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>column-width: inherit;<br>column-width: initial;<br>column-width: revert;<br>column-width: revert-layer;<br>column-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>column-width</code> property is specified as one of the values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Multiple-column_Layout"">Multiple-column Layout</a> (Learn Layout)</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Columns/Basic_Concepts_of_Multicol"">Basic Concepts of Multicol</a></li><br></ul>|css-sizing
"Sets the number of columns to use when drawing an element's contents, as well as those columns' widths"|columns|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/columns||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-width""><code>column-width</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-count""><code>column-count</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>Block containers except table wrapper boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-width""><code>column-width</code></a>: the absolute length, zero or larger</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-count""><code>column-count</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-width""><code>column-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-count""><code>column-count</code></a>: an <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/integer#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;integer&gt; CSS data type are interpolated via integer discrete steps. The calculation is done as if they were real, floating-point numbers and the discrete value is obtained using the floor function."">integer</a></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Column width */<br>columns: 18em;<br><br>/* Column count */<br>columns: auto;<br>columns: 2;<br><br>/* Both column width and count */<br>columns: 2 auto;<br>columns: auto 12em;<br>columns: auto auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>columns: inherit;<br>columns: initial;<br>columns: revert;<br>columns: revert-layer;<br>columns: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>columns</code> property may be specified as one or two of the values listed below, in any order.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/widows""><code>widows</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/orphans""><code>orphans</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Paged_Media"">Paged media</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Multiple-column_Layout"">Multiple-column Layout</a></li><br></ul>|css-multicol
"Allows an author to indicate that an element and its contents are, as much as possible, independent of the rest of the document tree"|contain|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/contain|<br>  Containment allows the browser to calculate layout, style, paint, size, or any combination of them for a specific area of the DOM<br>  Changes within an element with containment applied are not propagated outside of the contained element to the rest of the page, leading to performance benefits through fewer DOM re-renders<br><br>This property is useful on pages that contain a lot of widgets that are all independent, as it can be used to prevent each widget's internals from having side effects outside of the widget's bounding-box<br>Note: If applied (with value: layout, paint, strict or content), this property creates:<br><br>A new containing block (for the descendants whose position property is absolute or fixed)<br>A new stacking context<br>A new block formatting context|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>contain: none;<br>contain: strict;<br>contain: content;<br>contain: size;<br>contain: inline-size;<br>contain: layout;<br>contain: style;<br>contain: paint;<br><br>/* Multiple keywords */<br>contain: size paint;<br>contain: size layout paint;<br>contain: inline-size layout;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>contain: inherit;<br>contain: initial;<br>contain: revert;<br>contain: revert-layer;<br>contain: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>contain</code> property is specified as either one of the following:</p><br><ul><br><li>Using a single <code>none</code>, <code>strict</code>, or <code>content</code> keyword.</li><br><li>Using one or more of <code>size</code> (or <code>inline-size</code>), <code>layout</code>, <code>style</code>, <code>paint</code> keywords in any order.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a "Replaces an element with a generated value"|content|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/content| Objects inserted using the content property are anonymous replaced elements|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>All elements, tree-abiding pseudo-elements, and page margin boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>On elements, always computes to <code>normal</code>. On <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::before""><code>::before</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::after""><code>::after</code></a>, if <code>normal</code> is specified, computes to <code>none</code>. Otherwise, for URI values, the absolute URI; for <code>attr()</code> values, the resulting string; for other keywords, as specified.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keywords that cannot be combined with other values */<br>content: normal;<br>content: none;<br><br>/* <image> values */<br>content: url(""http://www.example.com/test.png"");<br>content: linear-gradient(#e66465, #9198e5);<br>content: image-set(""image1x.png"" 1x, ""image2x.png"" 2x);<br><br>/* alt text for generated content, added in the Level 3 specification */<br>content: url(""http://www.example.com/test.png"") / ""This is the alt text"";<br><br>/* <string> value */<br>content: ""prefix"";<br><br>/* <counter> values, optionally with <list-style-type> */<br>content: counter(chapter_counter);<br>content: counter(chapter_counter, upper-roman);<br>content: counters(section_counter, ""."");<br>content: counters(section_counter, ""."", decimal-leading-zero);<br><br>/* attr() value linked to the HTML attribute value */<br>content: attr(value string);<br><br>/* Language- and position-dependent keywords */<br>content: open-quote;<br>content: close-quote;<br>content: no-open-quote;<br>content: no-close-quote;<br><br>/* Except for normal and none, several values can be used simultaneously */<br>content: open-quote counter(chapter_counter);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>content: inherit;<br>content: initial;<br>content: revert;<br>content: revert-layer;<br>content: "Controls whether or not an element renders its contents at all, along with forcing a strong set of containments, allowing user agents to potentially omit large swathes of layout and rendering work until it becomes needed"|content-visibility|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/content-visibility| Basically it enables the user agent to skip an element's rendering work (including layout and painting) until it is needed  which makes the initial page load much faster|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>visible</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>elementsForWhichLayoutContainmentCanApply</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>content-visibility: visible;<br>content-visibility: hidden;<br>content-visibility: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>content-visibility: inherit;<br>content-visibility: initial;<br>content-visibility: revert;<br>content-visibility: revert-layer;<br>content-visibility: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Containment"">CSS Containment</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://web.dev/content-visibility/"" rel=""noopener"">content-visibility: the new CSS property that boosts your rendering performance</a> (web.dev)</li><br></ul>|css-contain
"Increases or decreases the value of a CSS counter by a given value"|counter-increment|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-increment|<br>Note: The counter's value can be reset to an arbitrary number using the counter-reset CSS property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Increment ""my-counter"" by 1 */<br>counter-increment: my-counter;<br><br>/* Decrement ""my-counter"" by 1 */<br>counter-increment: my-counter -1;<br><br>/* Increment ""counter1"" by 1, and decrement ""counter2"" by 4 */<br>counter-increment: counter1 counter2 -4;<br><br>/* Do not increment/decrement anything: used to override less specific rules */<br>counter-increment: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>counter-increment: inherit;<br>counter-increment: initial;<br>counter-increment: revert;<br>counter-increment: revert-layer;<br>counter-increment: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>counter-increment</code> property is specified as either one of the following:</p><br><ul><br><li>A <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> naming the counter, followed optionally by an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code>. You may specify as many counters to increment as you want, with each name or name-number pair separated by a space.</li><br><li>The keyword value <code>none</code>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Counter_Styles/Using_CSS_counters"">Using CSS Counters</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-reset""><code>counter-reset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-set""><code>counter-set</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@counter-style""><code>@counter-style</code></a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter""><code>counter()</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counters""><code>counters()</code></a> functions</li><br></ul>|css-lists
"Resets a CSS counter to a given value"|counter-reset|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-reset|<br>  This property will create a new counter or reversed counter with the given name on the specified element<br><br><br>  Normal counters have a default initial value of 0<br>  Reversed counters are intended to count down, and have a default initial value set to the number of elements at the current level<br>  The default initial values make it easy to implement the two most common numbering patterns: counting up from one to the number of elements, and counting down from the number of elements to one<br><br>A counter's value is increased or decreased using the counter-increment CSS property, and the value of an existing counter may be set using counter-set<br>  In addition to author-created counters, the property can also reset the list-item counters used by ordered lists (as created using <ol> elements)<br>  These have the same behavior as author-created counters, except they are automatically incremented/decremented by one with each list element<br>  This behavior can be overridden using counter-increment|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Set ""my-counter"" to 0 */<br>counter-reset: my-counter;<br><br>/* Set ""my-counter"" to -3 */<br>counter-reset: my-counter -3;<br><br>/* Set reversed ""my-counter"" to ""the number of peer elements"" */<br>counter-reset: reversed(my-counter);<br><br>/* Set reversed ""my-counter"" to -1 */<br>counter-reset: reversed(my-counter) -1;<br><br>/* Set counter2 to 9 and reversed ""counter1"" and ""counter3"" to 1 and 4, respectively*/<br>counter-reset: reversed(counter1) 1 counter2 9 reversed(counter3) 4;<br><br>/* Cancel any reset that could have been set in less specific rules */<br>counter-reset: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>counter-reset: inherit;<br>counter-reset: initial;<br>counter-reset: revert;<br>counter-reset: revert-layer;<br>counter-reset: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>counter-reset</code> property is specified as either one of the following:</p><br><ul><br><li><br>    A <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> or a <code>reversed(&lt;custom-ident&gt;)</code> naming the counter, followed optionally by an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code>.<br>    Note that the <code>reversed()</code> method is used to create a ""reversed"" counter.<br>    You may specify as many counters and reversed counters to reset as you want, with each counter or counter-number pair separated by a space.<br>  </li><br><li>The keyword value <code>none</code>.</li><br></ul><br><p>The ""implicit"" counter named <code>list-item</code> can be used to control the numbering for ordered lists, as created using <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ol""><code>&lt;ol&gt;</code></a></p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Counter_Styles/Using_CSS_counters"">Using CSS Counters</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-increment""><code>counter-increment</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-set""><code>counter-set</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@counter-style""><code>@counter-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter""><code>counter()</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counters""><code>counters()</code></a> functions</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/content""><code>content</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-lists
"Sets a CSS counter to a given value"|counter-set|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-set| It manipulates the value of existing counters, and will only create new counters if there isn't already a counter of the given name on the element<br>Note: The counter's value can be incremented or decremented using the counter-increment CSS property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Set ""my-counter"" to 0 */<br>counter-set: my-counter;<br><br>/* Set ""my-counter"" to -1 */<br>counter-set: my-counter -1;<br><br>/* Set ""counter1"" to 1, and ""counter2"" to 4 */<br>counter-set: counter1 1 counter2 4;<br><br>/* Cancel any counter that could have been set in less specific rules */<br>counter-set: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>counter-set: inherit;<br>counter-set: initial;<br>counter-set: revert;<br>counter-set: revert-layer;<br>counter-set: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>counter-set</code> property is specified as either one of the following:</p><br><ul><br><li>A <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> naming the counter, followed optionally by an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code>. You may specify as many counters to reset as you want, with each name or name-number pair separated by a space.</li><br><li>The keyword value <code>none</code>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Counter_Styles/Using_CSS_counters"">Using CSS Counters</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-increment""><code>counter-increment</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter-reset""><code>counter-reset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@counter-style""><code>@counter-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counter""><code>counter()</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/counters""><code>counters()</code></a> functions</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/content""><code>content</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-lists
"Sets the mouse cursor, if any, to show when the mouse pointer is over an element"|cursor|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor|<br><br>  The cursor setting should inform users of the mouse operations that can be performed at the current location, including: text selection, activating help or context menus, copying content, resizing tables, and so on<br>  You can specify either the type of cursor using a keyword, or load a specific icon to use (with optional fallback images and mandatory keyword as a final fallback)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/url""><code>url()</code></a> values made absolute</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>cursor: auto;<br>cursor: pointer;<br>/*  */<br>cursor: zoom-out;<br><br>/* URL with mandatory keyword fallback */<br>cursor: url(hand.cur), pointer;<br><br>/* URL and coordinates, with mandatory keyword fallback */<br>cursor: url(cursor_1.png) 4 12, auto;<br>cursor: url(cursor_2.png) 2 2, pointer;<br><br>/* URLs and fallback URLs (some with coordinates), with mandatory keyword fallback */<br>cursor: url(cursor_1.svg) 4 5, url(cursor_2.svg), /*  ,*/ url(cursor_n.cur) 5 5,<br>  progress;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>cursor: inherit;<br>cursor: initial;<br>cursor: revert;<br>cursor: revert-layer;<br>cursor: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p><br>  The <code>cursor</code> property is specified as zero or more <code>&lt;url&gt;</code> values, separated by commas, followed by a single mandatory keyword value.<br>  Each <code>&lt;url&gt;</code> should point to an image file.<br>  The browser will try to load the first image specified, falling back to the next if it can't, and falling back to the keyword value if no images could be loaded (or if none were specified).<br></p><br><p>Each <code>&lt;url&gt;</code> may be optionally followed by a pair of space-separated numbers, which set the <code>&lt;x&gt;</code> <code>&lt;y&gt;</code> coordinates of the cursor's hotspot relative to the top-left corner of the image.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/pointer-events""><code>pointer-events</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/url""><code>url()</code></a> function</li><br></ul>|css-ui
"Sets the direction of text, table columns, and horizontal overflow"|direction|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction| Use rtl for languages written from right to left (like Hebrew or Arabic), and ltr for those written from left to right (like English and most other languages)<br>Note that text direction is usually defined within a document (eg, with HTML's dir attribute) rather than through direct use of the direction property<br>The property sets the base text direction of block-level elements and the direction of embeddings created by the unicode-bidi property It also sets the default alignment of text, block-level elements, and the direction that cells flow within a table row<br>Unlike the dir attribute in HTML, the direction property is not inherited from table columns into table cells, since CSS inheritance follows the document tree, and table cells are inside of rows but not inside of columns<br>The direction and unicode-bidi properties are the two only properties which are not affected by the all shorthand property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>ltr</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>direction: ltr;<br>direction: rtl;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>direction: inherit;<br>direction: initial;<br>direction: revert;<br>direction: revert-layer;<br>direction: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a "Sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline element and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex"|display|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display|<br>Formally, the display property sets an element's inner and outer display types The outer type sets an element's participation in flow layout; the inner type sets the layout of children Some values of display are fully defined in their own individual specifications; for example the detail of what happens when display: flex is declared is defined in the CSS Flexible Box Model specification|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>inline</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as the specified value, except for positioned and floating elements and the root element. In both cases the computed value may be a keyword other than the one specified.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>Not animatable</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* precomposed values */<br>display: block;<br>display: inline;<br>display: inline-block;<br>display: flex;<br>display: inline-flex;<br>display: grid;<br>display: inline-grid;<br>display: flow-root;<br><br>/* box generation */<br>display: none;<br>display: contents;<br><br>/* two-value syntax */<br>display: block flow;<br>display: inline flow;<br>display: inline flow-root;<br>display: block flex;<br>display: inline flex;<br>display: block grid;<br>display: inline grid;<br>display: block flow-root;<br><br>/* other values */<br>display: table;<br>display: table-row; /* all table elements have an equivalent CSS display value */<br>display: list-item;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>display: inherit;<br>display: initial;<br>display: revert;<br>display: revert-layer;<br>display: unset;<br><br></pre><br><p>The CSS <code>display</code> property is specified using keyword values.</p><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flow_Layout/Block_and_Inline_Layout_in_Normal_Flow"">Block and inline layout in normal flow</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flow_Layout/Intro_to_formatting_contexts"">Introduction to formatting contexts</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/visibility""><code>visibility</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float""><code>float</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position""><code>position</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid""><code>grid</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex""><code>flex</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-display
"Sets whether borders and backgrounds appear around <table> cells that have no visible content"|empty-cells|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/empty-cells|<br>This property has an effect only when the border-collapse property is separate|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>show</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>table-cell elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>empty-cells: show;<br>empty-cells: hide;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>empty-cells: inherit;<br>empty-cells: initial;<br>empty-cells: revert;<br>empty-cells: revert-layer;<br>empty-cells: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>empty-cells</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-collapse""><code>border-collapse</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Styling_tables"">Styling tables</a></li><br></ul>|css2
"Applies graphical effects like blur or color shift to an element"|filter|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter| Filters are commonly used to adjust the rendering of images, backgrounds, and borders<br>Included in the CSS standard are several functions that achieve predefined effects You can also reference an SVG filter with a URL to an SVG filter element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter#Interpolation"" title=""If both filters have a function list of same length without URL, each of their filters functions is interpolated according to its specific rules. If they have different lengths, the missing equivalent filter functions from the longer list are added to the end of the shorter list using their default values, then all filter functions are interpolated according to their specific rules. If one filter is 'none', it is replaced with the filter functions list of the other one using the filter function default values, then all filter functions are interpolated according to their specific rules. Otherwise discrete interpolation is used."">filter function list</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* URL to SVG filter */<br>filter: url(""filters.svg#filter-id"");<br><br>/* <filter-function> values */<br>filter: blur(5px);<br>filter: brightness(0.4);<br>filter: contrast(200%);<br>filter: drop-shadow(16px 16px 20px blue);<br>filter: grayscale(50%);<br>filter: hue-rotate(90deg);<br>filter: invert(75%);<br>filter: opacity(25%);<br>filter: saturate(30%);<br>filter: sepia(60%);<br><br>/* Multiple filters */<br>filter: contrast(175%) brightness(3%);<br><br>/* Use no filter */<br>filter: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>filter: inherit;<br>filter: initial;<br>filter: revert;<br>filter: revert-layer;<br>filter: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>With a function, use the following:</p><br><div class=""code-example""><pre class=""brush: css notranslate""><code><span class=""token property"">filter</span><span class=""token punctuation"">:</span> &lt;filter-function&gt; [&lt;filter-function&gt;]* | none<br></code></pre></div><br><p>For a reference to an SVG <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/filter""><code>&lt;filter&gt;</code></a> element, use the following:</p><br><div class=""code-example""><pre class=""brush: css notranslate""><code><span class=""token property"">filter</span><span class=""token punctuation"">:</span> <span class=""token url""><span class=""token function"">url</span><span class=""token punctuation"">(</span>file.svg#filter-element-id<span class=""token punctuation"">)</span></span><br></code></pre></div>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Applying_SVG_effects_to_HTML_content"">Applying SVG effects to HTML content</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask""><code>mask</code></a> property</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG"">SVG</a></li><br></ul>|filter-effects
"Sets how a flex item will grow or shrink to fit the space available in its flex container"|flex|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-grow""><code>flex-grow</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-shrink""><code>flex-shrink</code></a>: <code>1</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis""><code>flex-basis</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex items, including in-flow pseudo-elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-grow""><code>flex-grow</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-shrink""><code>flex-shrink</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis""><code>flex-basis</code></a>: as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-grow""><code>flex-grow</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;number&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point, numbers."">number</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-shrink""><code>flex-shrink</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;number&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point, numbers."">number</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis""><code>flex-basis</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>flex: auto;<br>flex: initial;<br>flex: none;<br><br>/* One value, unitless number: flex-grow<br>flex-basis is then equal to 0. */<br>flex: 2;<br><br>/* One value, width/height: flex-basis */<br>flex: 10em;<br>flex: 30%;<br>flex: min-content;<br><br>/* Two values: flex-grow | flex-basis */<br>flex: 1 30px;<br><br>/* Two values: flex-grow | flex-shrink */<br>flex: 2 2;<br><br>/* Three values: flex-grow | flex-shrink | flex-basis */<br>flex: 2 2 10%;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex: inherit;<br>flex: initial;<br>flex: revert;<br>flex: revert-layer;<br>flex: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>flex</code> property may be specified using one, two, or three values.</p><br><ul><br><li><strong>One-value syntax:</strong> the value must be one of:<br>    <ul><br><li>a <code>&lt;number&gt;</code>: In this case it is interpreted as <code>flex: &lt;number&gt; 1 0</code>; the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-shrink""><code>flex-shrink</code></a> value is assumed to be <code>1</code> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis""><code>flex-basis</code></a> value is assumed to be <code>0</code>.</li><br><li>a <code>&lt;width&gt;</code>: In this case it is interpreted as <code>flex: 1 1 &lt;width&gt;</code>; the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-grow""><code>flex-grow</code></a> value is assumed to be <code>1</code> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-shrink""><code>flex-shrink</code></a> value is assumed to be <code>1</code>.</li><br><li>one of the keywords: <code>none</code>, <code>auto</code>, or <code>initial</code>.</li><br></ul><br></li><br><li><strong>Two-value syntax:</strong><br><ul><br><li>The first value must be:<br>        <ul><br><li>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a> and it is interpreted as <code>&lt;flex-grow&gt;</code>.</li><br></ul><br></li><br><li>The second value must be one of:<br>        <ul><br><li>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a>: then it is interpreted as <code>&lt;flex-shrink&gt;</code>.</li><br><li>a valid value for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a>: then it is interpreted as <code>&lt;flex-basis&gt;</code>.</li><br></ul><br></li><br></ul><br></li><br><li><strong>Three-value syntax:</strong> the values must be in the following order:<br>    <ol><br><li>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a> for <code>&lt;flex-grow&gt;</code>.</li><br><li>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a> for <code>&lt;flex-shrink&gt;</code>.</li><br><li>a valid value for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> for <code>&lt;flex-basis&gt;</code>.</li><br></ol><br></li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Controlling_Ratios_of_Flex_Items_Along_the_Main_Ax"">Controlling Ratios of flex items along the main axis</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-flexbox
"Sets the initial main size of a flex item"|flex-basis|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis| It sets the size of the content box unless otherwise set with box-sizing<br>In this example, the flex-grow and flex-shrink properties are both set to 1 on all three items, indicating that the flex item can grow and shrink from the initial flex-basis<br>The demo then changes the flex-basis on the first item It will then grow and shrink from that flex-basis This means that, for example, when the flex-basis of the first item is 200px, it will start out at 200px but then shrink to fit the space available with the other items being at least min-content sized<br>The image below shows how the Firefox Flexbox Inspector helps you understand the size items become:<br><br>Note: In case both flex-basis (other than auto) and width (or height in case of flex-direction: column) are set for an element, flex-basis has priority|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex items, including in-flow pseudo-elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the flex container's inner main size</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Specify <'width'> */<br>flex-basis: 10em;<br>flex-basis: 3px;<br>flex-basis: 50%;<br>flex-basis: auto;<br><br>/* Intrinsic sizing keywords */<br>flex-basis: max-content;<br>flex-basis: min-content;<br>flex-basis: fit-content;<br><br>/* Automatically size based on the flex item's content */<br>flex-basis: content;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex-basis: inherit;<br>flex-basis: initial;<br>flex-basis: revert;<br>flex-basis: revert-layer;<br>flex-basis: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>flex-basis</code> property is specified as either the keyword <code>content</code> or a <code>&lt;'width'&gt;</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Controlling_Ratios_of_Flex_Items_Along_the_Main_Ax"">Controlling Ratios of flex items along the main axis</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-flexbox
"Sets how flex items are placed in the flex container defining the main axis and the direction (normal or reversed)"|flex-direction|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-direction|<br>Note that the values row and row-reverse are affected by the directionality of the flex container If its dir attribute is ltr, row represents the horizontal axis oriented from the left to the right, and row-reverse from the right to the left; if the dir attribute is rtl, row represents the axis oriented from the right to the left, and row-reverse from the left to the right|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>row</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* The direction text is laid out in a line */<br>flex-direction: row;<br><br>/* Like <row>, but reversed */<br>flex-direction: row-reverse;<br><br>/* The direction in which lines of text are stacked */<br>flex-direction: column;<br><br>/* Like <column>, but reversed */<br>flex-direction: column-reverse;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex-direction: inherit;<br>flex-direction: initial;<br>flex-direction: revert;<br>flex-direction: revert-layer;<br>flex-direction: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Ordering_Flex_Items"">Ordering flex items</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-flexbox
"Specifies the direction of a flex container, as well as its wrapping behavior"|flex-flow|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-flow||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a column wrap;<br>flex-flow: column-reverse wrap-reverse;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex-flow: inherit;<br>flex-flow: initial;<br>flex-flow: revert;<br>flex-flow: revert-layer;<br>flex-flow: "Sets the flex grow factor of a flex item's main size"|flex-grow|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-grow||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex items, including in-flow pseudo-elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;number&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point, numbers."">number</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <number> values */<br>flex-grow: 3;<br>flex-grow: 0.6;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex-grow: inherit;<br>flex-grow: initial;<br>flex-grow: revert;<br>flex-grow: revert-layer;<br>flex-grow: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>flex-grow</code> property is specified as a single <code>&lt;number&gt;</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Controlling_Ratios_of_Flex_Items_Along_the_Main_Ax"">Controlling Ratios of flex items along the main axis</a></em></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/flex-grow-is-weird/"" rel=""noopener""><code>flex-grow</code> is weird.
