"Sets the flex shrink factor of a flex item"|flex-shrink|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-shrink| If the size of all flex items is larger than the flex container, items shrink to fit according to flex-shrink<br>In use, flex-shrink is used alongside the other flex properties flex-grow and flex-basis, and normally defined using the flex shorthand|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>1</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex items, including in-flow pseudo-elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;number&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point, numbers."">number</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <number> values */<br>flex-shrink: 2;<br>flex-shrink: 0.6;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex-shrink: inherit;<br>flex-shrink: initial;<br>flex-shrink: revert;<br>flex-shrink: revert-layer;<br>flex-shrink: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>flex-shrink</code> property is specified as a single <code>&lt;number&gt;</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Controlling_Ratios_of_Flex_Items_Along_the_Main_Ax"">Controlling Ratios of flex items along the main axis</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-flexbox
"Sets whether flex items are forced onto one line or can wrap onto multiple lines"|flex-wrap|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-wrap| If wrapping is allowed, it sets the direction that lines are stacked<br>See Using CSS flexible boxes for more properties and information|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>nowrap</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>flex-wrap: nowrap; /* Default value */<br>flex-wrap: wrap;<br>flex-wrap: wrap-reverse;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>flex-wrap: inherit;<br>flex-wrap: initial;<br>flex-wrap: revert;<br>flex-wrap: revert-layer;<br>flex-wrap: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>flex-wrap</code> property is specified as a single keyword chosen from the list of values below.</p>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Mastering_Wrapping_of_Flex_Items"">Mastering wrapping of flex items</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-flexbox
"Places an element on the left or right side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it"|float|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float| The element is removed from the normal flow of the page, though still remaining a part of the flow (in contrast to absolute positioning)<br>A floating element is one where the computed value of float is not none<br>As float implies the use of the block layout, it modifies the computed value of the display values, in some cases:<br>Specified value<br>Computed value<br><br><br><br><br>inline<br>block<br><br><br>inline-block<br>block<br><br><br>inline-table<br>table<br><br><br>table-row<br>block<br><br><br>table-row-group<br>block<br><br><br>table-column<br>block<br><br><br>table-column-group<br>block<br><br><br>table-cell<br>block<br><br><br>table-caption<br>block<br><br><br>table-header-group<br>block<br><br><br>table-footer-group<br>block<br><br><br>inline-flex<br>flex<br><br><br>inline-grid<br>grid<br><br><br>other<br>unchanged<br><br><br>Note: If you're referring to this property from JavaScript as a member of the HTMLElementstyle object, modern browsers support float, but in older browsers you have to spell it as cssFloat, with Internet Explorer versions 8 and older using styleFloat This was an exception to the rule, that the name of the DOM member is the camel-case name of the dash-separated CSS name (because ""float"" is a reserved word in JavaScript, as seen in the need to escape ""class"" as ""className"" and escape <label>'s ""for"" as ""htmlFor"")|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, but has no effect if the value of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a> is <code>none</code>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>float: left;<br>float: right;<br>float: none;<br>float: inline-start;<br>float: inline-end;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>float: inherit;<br>float: initial;<br>float: revert;<br>float: revert-layer;<br>float: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>float</code> property is specified as a single keyword, chosen from the list of values below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/CSS/Block_formatting_context"">Block formatting context</a></li><br><li>Use <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clear""><code>clear</code></a> to force an item to move below a floated element.</li><br></ul>|css2
"Specifies a prioritized list of one or more font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element"|font-family|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-family|<br>Values are separated by commas to indicate that they are alternatives The browser will select the first font in the list that is installed or that can be downloaded using a @font-face at-rule<br>It is often convenient to use the shorthand property font to set font-size and other font related properties all at once<br>You should always include at least one generic family name in a font-family list, since there's no guarantee that any given font is available This lets the browser select an acceptable fallback font when necessary<br>The font-family property specifies a list of fonts, from highest priority to lowest Font selection does not stop at the first font in the list that is on the user's system Rather, font selection is done one character at a time, so that if an available font does not have a glyph for a needed character, the latter fonts are tried When a font is only available in some styles, variants, or sizes, those properties may also influence which font family is chosen|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>depends on user agent</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* A font family name and a generic family name */<br>font-family: ""Gill Sans Extrabold"", sans-serif;<br>font-family: ""Goudy Bookletter 1911"", sans-serif;<br><br>/* A generic family name only */<br>font-family: serif;<br>font-family: sans-serif;<br>font-family: monospace;<br>font-family: cursive;<br>font-family: fantasy;<br>font-family: system-ui;<br>font-family: ui-serif;<br>font-family: ui-sans-serif;<br>font-family: ui-monospace;<br>font-family: ui-rounded;<br>font-family: emoji;<br>font-family: math;<br>font-family: fangsong;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-family: inherit;<br>font-family: initial;<br>font-family: revert;<br>font-family: revert-layer;<br>font-family: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>font-family</code> property lists one or more font families, separated by commas. Each font family is specified as either a <code>&lt;family-name&gt;</code> or a <code>&lt;generic-name&gt;</code> value.</p><br><p>The example below lists two font families, the first with a <code>&lt;family-name&gt;</code> and the second with a <code>&lt;generic-name&gt;</code>:</p><br><div class=""code-example""><pre class=""brush: css notranslate""><code><span class=""token property"">font-family</span><span class=""token punctuation"">:</span> <span class=""token string"">""Gill Sans Extrabold""</span><span class=""token punctuation"">,</span> sans-serif<span class=""token punctuation"">;</span><br></code></pre></div>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-style""><code>font-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-weight""><code>font-weight</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals"">Fundamental text and font styling</a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Controls advanced typographic features in OpenType fonts"|font-feature-settings|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-feature-settings||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Use the default settings */<br>font-feature-settings: normal;<br><br>/* Set values for OpenType feature tags */<br>font-feature-settings: ""smcp"";<br>font-feature-settings: ""smcp"" on;<br>font-feature-settings: ""swsh"" 2;<br>font-feature-settings: ""smcp"", ""swsh"" 2;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-feature-settings: inherit;<br>font-feature-settings: initial;<br>font-feature-settings: revert;<br>font-feature-settings: revert-layer;<br>font-feature-settings: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>Whenever possible, Web authors should instead use the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant""><code>font-variant</code></a> shorthand property or an associated longhand property such as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-ligatures""><code>font-variant-ligatures</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps""><code>font-variant-caps</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-east-asian""><code>font-variant-east-asian</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-alternates""><code>font-variant-alternates</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-numeric""><code>font-variant-numeric</code></a> or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-position""><code>font-variant-position</code></a>.</p><br><p>These lead to more effective, predictable, understandable results than <code>font-feature-settings</code>, which is a low-level feature designed to handle special cases where no other way exists to enable or access an OpenType font feature. In particular, <code>font-feature-settings</code> shouldn't be used to enable small caps.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-display""><code>font-display</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-family""><code>font-family</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-stretch""><code>font-stretch</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-style""><code>font-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-weight""><code>font-weight</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face""><code>font-variant</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/font-variation-settings""><code>font-variation-settings</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/src""><code>src</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/unicode-range""><code>unicode-range</code></a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://docs.microsoft.com/typography/opentype/spec/featurelist"" rel=""noopener"">OpenType Feature Tags</a> list</li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Sets the use of the kerning information stored in a font"|font-kerning|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-kerning|<br>Kerning defines how letters are spaced In well-kerned fonts, this feature makes character spacing more uniform and pleasant to read than it would otherwise be<br>In the image below, for instance, the examples on the left do not use kerning, while the ones on the right do:|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>font-kerning: auto;<br>font-kerning: normal;<br>font-kerning: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-kerning: inherit;<br>font-kerning: initial;<br>font-kerning: revert;<br>font-kerning: revert-layer;<br>font-kerning: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant""><code>font-variant</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-position""><code>font-variant-position</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-east-asian""><code>font-variant-east-asian</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps""><code>font-variant-caps</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-ligatures""><code>font-variant-ligatures</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-numeric""><code>font-variant-numeric</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-alternates""><code>font-variant-alternates</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-synthesis""><code>font-synthesis</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/letter-spacing""><code>letter-spacing</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Sets whether text rendering is optimized for viewing at different sizes"|font-optical-sizing|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-optical-sizing||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* keyword values */<br>font-optical-sizing: none;<br>font-optical-sizing: auto; /* default */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-optical-sizing: inherit;<br>font-optical-sizing: initial;<br>font-optical-sizing: revert;<br>font-optical-sizing: revert-layer;<br>font-optical-sizing: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size""><code>font-size</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size-adjust""><code>font-size-adjust</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals"">Fundamental text and font styling</a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Sets the size of the font"|font-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size| Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>medium</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the parent element's font size</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <absolute-size> values */<br>font-size: xx-small;<br>font-size: x-small;<br>font-size: small;<br>font-size: medium;<br>font-size: large;<br>font-size: x-large;<br>font-size: xx-large;<br>font-size: xxx-large;<br><br>/* <relative-size> values */<br>font-size: smaller;<br>font-size: larger;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>font-size: 12px;<br>font-size: 0.8em;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>font-size: 80%;<br><br>/* math value */<br>font-size: math;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-size: inherit;<br>font-size: initial;<br>font-size: revert;<br>font-size: revert-layer;<br>font-size: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>font-size</code> property is specified in one of the following ways:</p><br><ul><br><li>As one of the absolute-size, relative-size or <code>math</code> keywords</li><br><li>As a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code> or a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code>, relative to the element's font size.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size-adjust""><code>font-size-adjust</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-style""><code>font-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-weight""><code>font-weight</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/math-depth""><code>math-depth</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/math-style""><code>math-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals"">Fundamental text and font styling</a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font"|font-stretch|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-stretch||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. The interpolation happens as though the ordered values are equally spaced real numbers; the result is rounded to the nearest value, with values exactly halfway between two values rounded towards the later value, that is the most expanded one."">font stretch</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>font-stretch: ultra-condensed;<br>font-stretch: extra-condensed;<br>font-stretch: condensed;<br>font-stretch: semi-condensed;<br>font-stretch: normal;<br>font-stretch: semi-expanded;<br>font-stretch: expanded;<br>font-stretch: extra-expanded;<br>font-stretch: ultra-expanded;<br><br>/* Percentage values */<br>font-stretch: 50%;<br>font-stretch: 100%;<br>font-stretch: 200%;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-stretch: inherit;<br>font-stretch: initial;<br>font-stretch: revert;<br>font-stretch: revert-layer;<br>font-stretch: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property may be specified as a single keyword value or a single <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a> value.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-style""><code>font-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-weight""><code>font-weight</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals"">Fundamental text and font styling</a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family"|font-style|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-style|<br>Italic font faces are generally cursive in nature, usually using less horizontal space than their unstyled counterparts, while oblique faces are usually just sloped versions of the regular face When the specified style is not available, both italic and oblique faces are simulated by artificially sloping the glyphs of the regular face (use font-synthesis to control this behavior)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Controls the use of alternate glyphs for capital letters"|font-variant-caps|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps|<br>When a given font includes capital letter glyphs of multiple different sizes, this property selects the most appropriate ones If petite capital glyphs are not available, they are rendered using small capital glyphs If these are not present, the browser synthesizes them from the uppercase glyphs<br>Fonts sometimes include special glyphs for various caseless characters (such as punctuation marks) to better match the capitalized characters around them However, small capital glyphs are never synthesized for caseless characters|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Controls which ligatures and contextual forms are used in textual content of the elements it applies to"|font-variant-ligatures|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-ligatures| This leads to more harmonized forms in the resulting text|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>font-variant-ligatures: normal;<br>font-variant-ligatures: none;<br>font-variant-ligatures: common-ligatures; /* <common-lig-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: no-common-ligatures; /* <common-lig-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: discretionary-ligatures; /* <discretionary-lig-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: no-discretionary-ligatures; /* <discretionary-lig-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: historical-ligatures; /* <historical-lig-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: no-historical-ligatures; /* <historical-lig-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: contextual; /* <contextual-alt-values> */<br>font-variant-ligatures: no-contextual; /* <contextual-alt-values> */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-variant-ligatures: inherit;<br>font-variant-ligatures: initial;<br>font-variant-ligatures: revert;<br>font-variant-ligatures: revert-layer;<br>font-variant-ligatures: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>font-variant-ligatures</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-alternates""><code>font-variant-alternates</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps""><code>font-variant-caps</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-east-asian""><code>font-variant-east-asian</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant""><code>font-variant</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-numeric""><code>font-variant-numeric</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for numbers, fractions, and ordinal markers"|font-variant-numeric|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-numeric||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>font-variant-numeric: normal;<br>font-variant-numeric: ordinal;<br>font-variant-numeric: slashed-zero;<br>font-variant-numeric: lining-nums; /* <numeric-figure-values> */<br>font-variant-numeric: oldstyle-nums; /* <numeric-figure-values> */<br>font-variant-numeric: proportional-nums; /* <numeric-spacing-values> */<br>font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums; /* <numeric-spacing-values> */<br>font-variant-numeric: diagonal-fractions; /* <numeric-fraction-values> */<br>font-variant-numeric: stacked-fractions; /* <numeric-fraction-values> */<br>font-variant-numeric: oldstyle-nums stacked-fractions;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-variant-numeric: inherit;<br>font-variant-numeric: initial;<br>font-variant-numeric: revert;<br>font-variant-numeric: revert-layer;<br>font-variant-numeric: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property can take one of two forms:</p><br><ul><br><li>either the keyword value <code>normal</code></li><br><li>or one or more of the other values listed below, space-separated, in any order.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-alternates""><code>font-variant-alternates</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps""><code>font-variant-caps</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-east-asian""><code>font-variant-east-asian</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-ligatures""><code>font-variant-ligatures</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant""><code>font-variant</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Provides low-level control over variable font characteristics, by specifying the four letter axis names of the characteristics you want to vary, along with their values"|font-variation-settings|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variation-settings||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Sets the weight (or boldness) of the font"|font-weight|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-weight| The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. The interpolation happens in real number space and is converted to an integer by rounding to the nearest multiple of 100, with values halfway between multiples of 100 rounded towards positive infinity."">font weight</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>font-weight: normal;<br>font-weight: bold;<br><br>/* Keyword values relative to the parent */<br>font-weight: lighter;<br>font-weight: bolder;<br><br>/* Numeric keyword values */<br>font-weight: 100;<br>font-weight: 200;<br>font-weight: 300;<br>font-weight: 400; /* normal */<br>font-weight: 500;<br>font-weight: 600;<br>font-weight: 700; /* bold */<br>font-weight: 800;<br>font-weight: 900;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>font-weight: inherit;<br>font-weight: initial;<br>font-weight: revert;<br>font-weight: revert-layer;<br>font-weight: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>font-weight</code> property is specified using any one of the values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-family""><code>font-family</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-style""><code>font-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals"">Fundamental text and font styling</a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"Allows authors to opt certain elements out of forced colors mode"|forced-color-adjust|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/forced-color-adjust| This then restores the control of those values to CSS|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements and text</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>Not animatable</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>forced-color-adjust: auto;<br>forced-color-adjust: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>forced-color-adjust: inherit;<br>forced-color-adjust: initial;<br>forced-color-adjust: revert;<br>forced-color-adjust: revert-layer;<br>forced-color-adjust: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>forced-color-adjust</code> property's value must be one of the following keywords.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Colors/Applying_color"">Applying color to HTML elements using CSS</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://blogs.windows.com/msedgedev/2020/09/17/styling-for-windows-high-contrast-with-new-standards-for-forced-colors/"" rel=""noopener"">Styling for Windows high contrast with standards for forced colors.</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/print-color-adjust""><code>print-color-adjust</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-color-adjust
"Sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns"|gap|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/gap| It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap<br>Note that grid-gap is an alias for this property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/row-gap""><code>row-gap</code></a>: <code>normal</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-gap""><code>column-gap</code></a>: <code>normal</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>multi-column elements, flex containers, grid containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/row-gap""><code>row-gap</code></a>: as specified, with &lt;length&gt;s made absolute, and normal computing to zero except on multi-column elements</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-gap""><code>column-gap</code></a>: as specified, with &lt;length&gt;s made absolute, and normal computing to zero except on multi-column elements</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/row-gap""><code>row-gap</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-gap""><code>column-gap</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* One <length> value */<br>gap: 20px;<br>gap: 1em;<br>gap: 3vmin;<br>gap: 0.5cm;<br><br>/* One <percentage> value */<br>gap: 16%;<br>gap: 100%;<br><br>/* Two <length> values */<br>gap: 20px 10px;<br>gap: 1em 0.5em;<br>gap: 3vmin 2vmax;<br>gap: 0.5cm 2mm;<br><br>/* One or two <percentage> values */<br>gap: 16% 100%;<br>gap: 21px 82%;<br><br>/* calc() values */<br>gap: calc(10% + 20px);<br>gap: calc(20px + 10%) calc(10% - 5px);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>gap: inherit;<br>gap: initial;<br>gap: revert;<br>gap: revert-layer;<br>gap: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property is specified as a value for <code>&lt;'row-gap'&gt;</code> followed optionally by a value for <code>&lt;'column-gap'&gt;</code>. If <code>&lt;'column-gap'&gt;</code> is omitted, it's set to the same value as <code>&lt;'row-gap'&gt;</code>.</p><br><p><code>&lt;'row-gap'&gt;</code> and <code>&lt;'column-gap'&gt;</code> are each specified as a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code> or a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/row-gap""><code>row-gap</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-gap""><code>column-gap</code></a></li><br><li>Grid Layout Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Grid_Layout#gutters"">Basic concepts of grid layout - Gutters</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-align
"Is a shorthand property that sets all of the explicit and implicit grid properties in a single declaration"|grid|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid|<br>Using grid you specify one axis using grid-template-rows or grid-template-columns, you then specify how content should auto-repeat in the other axis using the implicit grid properties: grid-auto-rows, grid-auto-columns, and grid-auto-flow<br>Note: The sub-properties you don't specify are set to their initial value, as normal for shorthands Also, the gutter properties are NOT reset by this shorthand|<table href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-auto-rows""><code>grid-auto-rows</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a "Specifies a grid item's size and location within a grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the edges of its grid area"|grid-area|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-area|<br>If four <grid-line> values are specified, grid-row-start is set to the first value, grid-column-start is set to the second value, grid-row-end is set to the third value, and grid-column-end is set to the fourth value<br>When grid-column-end is omitted, if grid-column-start is a <custom-ident>, grid-column-end is set to that <custom-ident>; otherwise, it is set to auto<br>When grid-row-end is omitted, if grid-row-start is a <custom-ident>, grid-row-end is set to that <custom-ident>; otherwise, it is set to auto<br>When grid-column-start is omitted, if grid-row-start is a <custom-ident>, all four longhands are set to that value Otherwise, it is set to auto<br>The grid-area property can also be set to a <custom-ident> which acts as a name for the area, which can then be placed using grid-template-areas|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-start""><code>grid-row-start</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-start""><code>grid-column-start</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-end""><code>grid-row-end</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-end""><code>grid-column-end</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>grid items and absolutely-positioned boxes whose containing block is a grid container</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-start""><code>grid-row-start</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-start""><code>grid-column-start</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-end""><code>grid-row-end</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-end""><code>grid-column-end</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>grid-area: auto;<br>grid-area: auto / auto;<br>grid-area: auto / auto / auto;<br>grid-area: auto / auto / auto / auto;<br><br>/* <custom-ident> values */<br>grid-area: some-grid-area;<br>grid-area: some-grid-area / another-grid-area;<br><br>/* <integer> && <custom-ident>? values */<br>grid-area: 4 some-grid-area;<br>grid-area: 4 some-grid-area / 2 another-grid-area;<br><br>/* span && [ <integer> || <custom-ident> ] values */<br>grid-area: span 3;<br>grid-area: span 3 / span some-grid-area;<br>grid-area: 2 span / another-grid-area span;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>grid-area: inherit;<br>grid-area: initial;<br>grid-area: revert;<br>grid-area: revert-layer;<br>grid-area: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row""><code>grid-row</code></a>, <a "Specifies the size of an implicitly-created grid column track or pattern of tracks"|grid-auto-columns|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-auto-columns|<br>If a grid item is positioned into a column that is not explicitly sized by grid-template-columns, implicit grid tracks are created to hold it This can happen either by explicitly positioning into a column that is out of range, or by the auto-placement algorithm creating additional columns|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>grid containers</td></tr><tr><th the content area</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>grid-auto-columns: min-content;<br>grid-auto-columns: revert-layer;<br>grid-column: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property is specified as one or two <code>&lt;grid-line&gt;</code> values.</p><br><p>If two <code>&lt;grid-line&gt;</code> values are given they are separated by ""/"". The <code>grid-column-start</code> longhand is set to the value before the slash, and the <code>grid-column-end</code> longhand is set to the value after the slash.</p><br><p>Each <code>&lt;grid-line&gt;</code> value can be specified as:</p><br><ul><br><li>either the <code>auto</code> keyword</li><br><li>or a <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> value</li><br><li>or an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code> value</li><br><li>or both <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> and <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code>, separated by a space</li><br><li>or the keyword <code>span</code> together with either a <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> or an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code> or both.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row""><code>grid-row</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-start""><code>grid-row-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-end""><code>grid-row-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-start""><code>grid-column-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-end""><code>grid-column-end</code></a></li><br><li>Grid Layout Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Line-based_Placement_with_CSS_Grid"">Line-based placement with CSS Grid</a></em></li><br><li>Video tutorial: <em><a class=""external"" href=""https://gridbyexample.com/video/series-line-based-placement/"" rel=""noopener"">Line-based placement</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-grid

"Specifies a grid item's size and location within the grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the inline-start and inline-end edge of its grid area"|grid-row|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row|<br>If two <grid-line> values are specified, the grid-row-start longhand is set to the value before the slash, and the grid-row-end longhand is set to the value after the slash|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-end""><code>grid-row-end</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>grid items and absolutely-positioned boxes whose containing block is a grid container</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>grid-row: auto;<br>grid-row: auto / auto;<br><br>/* <custom-ident> values */<br>grid-row: somegridarea;<br>grid-row: "Specifies a grid item's start position within the grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the inline-start edge of its grid area"|grid-row-start|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-start||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>grid items and absolutely-positioned boxes whose containing block is a grid container</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>grid-row-start: auto;<br><br>/* <custom-ident> values */<br>grid-row-start: somegridarea;<br><br>/* <integer> + <custom-ident> values */<br>grid-row-start: 2;<br>grid-row-start: somegridarea 4;<br><br>/* span + <integer> + <custom-ident> values */<br>grid-row-start: span 3;<br>grid-row-start: span somegridarea;<br>grid-row-start: 5 somegridarea span;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>grid-row-start: inherit;<br>grid-row-start: initial;<br>grid-row-start: revert;<br>grid-row-start: revert-layer;<br>grid-row-start: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property is specified as a single <code>&lt;grid-line&gt;</code> value. A <code>&lt;grid-line&gt;</code> value can be specified as:</p><br><ul><br><li>either the <code>auto</code> keyword</li><br><li>or a <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> value</li><br><li>or an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code> value</li><br><li>or both <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> and <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code>, separated by a space</li><br><li>or the keyword <code>span</code> together with either a <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> or an <code>&lt;integer&gt;</code> or both.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row-end""><code>grid-row-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-row""><code>grid-row</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-start""><code>grid-column-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column-end""><code>grid-column-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-column""><code>grid-column</code></a></li><br><li>Grid Layout Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Line-based_Placement_with_CSS_Grid"">Line-based placement with CSS Grid</a></em></li><br><li>Video tutorial: <em><a class=""external"" href=""https://gridbyexample.com/video/series-line-based-placement/"" rel=""noopener"">Line-based placement</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-grid

"Specifies the height of an element"|height|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height| By default, the property defines the height of the content area If box-sizing is set to border-box, however, it instead determines the height of the border area<br>The min-height and max-height properties override height|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements but non-replaced inline elements, table columns, and column groups</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>The percentage is calculated with respect to the height of the generated box's containing block. If the height of the containing block is not specified explicitly (i.e., it depends on content height), and this element is not absolutely positioned, the value computes to <code>auto</code>. A percentage height on the root element is relative to the initial containing block.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>a percentage or <code>auto</code> or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>height: 120px;<br>height: 10em;<br>height: 100vh;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>height: 75%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>height: max-content;<br>height: min-content;<br>height: fit-content(20em);<br>height: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>height: inherit;<br>height: initial;<br>height: revert;<br>height: revert-layer;<br>height: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">The box model</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-sizing""><code>box-sizing</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-height""><code>min-height</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height""><code>max-height</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/block-size""><code>block-size</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inline-size""><code>inline-size</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-sizing
"Sets the character (or string) used at the end of a line before a hyphenation break"|hyphenate-character|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/hyphenate-character|<br>Both automatic and soft hyphens are displayed according to the specified hyphenate-character value|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>hyphenate-character: <string>;<br>hyphenate-character: auto;<br><br></pre><br><p>The value either sets the string to use instead of a hyphen, or indicates that the user agent should select an appropriate string based on the current typographic conventions (default).</p><br>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/hyphens""><code>hyphens</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-wrap""><code>overflow-wrap</code></a>.</li><br></ul>|css-text-4
"Specifies how words should be hyphenated when text wraps across multiple lines"|hyphens|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/hyphens| It can prevent hyphenation entirely, hyphenate at manually-specified points within the text, or let the browser automatically insert hyphens where appropriate<br>Note: In the above demo, the string ""An extraordinarily long English word!"" contains the hidden &shy; (soft hyphen) character: An extra&shy;ordinarily long English word! This character is used to indicate a potential place to insert a hyphen when hyphens: manual; is specified<br>Hyphenation rules are language-specific In HTML, the language is determined by the lang attribute, and browsers will hyphenate only if this attribute is present and the appropriate hyphenation dictionary is available In XML, the xml:lang attribute must be used<br>Note: The rules defining how hyphenation is performed are not explicitly defined by the specification, so the exact hyphenation may vary from browser to browser<br>If supported, hyphenate-character may be used to specify an alternative hyphenation character to use at the end of the line being broken|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>manual</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>hyphens: none;<br>hyphens: manual;<br>hyphens: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>hyphens: inherit;<br>hyphens: initial;<br>hyphens: revert;<br>hyphens: revert-layer;<br>hyphens: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>hyphens</code> property is specified as a single keyword value chosen from the list below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/content""><code>content</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-wrap""><code>overflow-wrap</code></a> (formerly <code>word-wrap</code>)</li><br><li><a to wrapping and breaking text</a></li><br></ul>|css-text
"Sets an image scaling algorithm"|image-rendering|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/image-rendering| The property applies to an element itself, to any images set in its other properties, and to its descendants<br>The user agent will scale an image when the page author specifies dimensions other than its natural size Scaling may also occur due to user interaction (zooming) For example, if the natural size of an image is 100100px, but its actual dimensions are 200200px (or 5050px), then the image will be upscaled (or downscaled) using the algorithm specified by image-rendering This property has no effect on non-scaled images|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>image-rendering: auto;<br>image-rendering: crisp-edges;<br>image-rendering: pixelated;<br><br>/* Global values CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit""><code>object-fit</code></a>, <a "Defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode"|inline-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inline-size| It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode<br>If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of inline-size relates to the height of the element; otherwise, it relates to the width of the element A related property is block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>inline-size of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; "Is a shorthand that corresponds to the top, right, bottom, and/or left properties"|inset|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset| It has the same multi-value syntax of the margin shorthand<br>While part of the CSS Logical Properties specification, it does not define logical offsets It defines physical offsets, regardless of the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/top""><code>top</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom""><code>bottom</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left""><code>left</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/right""><code>right</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>positioned elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>relative to the containing blocks size in the corresponding axis (e.g. width for left or right, height for top or bottom)</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/top""><code>top</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom""><code>bottom</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left""><code>left</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/right""><code>right</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>inset: 10px; /* value applied to all edges */<br>inset: 4px 8px; /* top/bottom left/right */<br>inset: 5px 15px 10px; /* top left/right bottom */<br>inset: 2.4em 3em 3em 3em; /* top right bottom left */<br><br>/* <percentage>s of the width (left/right) or height (top/bottom) of the containing block */<br>inset: 10% 5% 5% 5%;<br><br>/* Keyword value */<br>inset: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>inset: inherit;<br>inset: initial;<br>inset: revert;<br>inset: revert-layer;<br>inset: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The longhand box offset properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/top""><code>top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/right""><code>right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom""><code>bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left""><code>left</code></a>.</li><br><li>The mapped logical shorthands: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block""><code>inset-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline""><code>inset-inline</code></a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a> shorthand multi-value syntax.</li><br></ul>|css-logical

CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; "Defines the logical block start offset of an element, which maps to a physical inset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|inset-block-start|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block-start| It corresponds to the top, right, bottom, or left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>positioned elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>logical-height of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>same as box offsets: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/top""><code>top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/right""><code>right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom""><code>bottom</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left""><code>left</code></a> properties except that directions are logical</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt;
