"Determines whether an element must create a new stacking context"|isolation|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/isolation|<br>This property is especially helpful when used in conjunction with mix-blend-mode and z-index|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>All elements. In SVG, it applies to container elements, graphics elements, and graphics referencing elements.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>isolation: auto;<br>isolation: isolate;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>isolation: inherit;<br>isolation: initial;<br>isolation: revert;<br>isolation: revert-layer;<br>isolation: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>isolation</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/blend-mode""><code>&lt;blend-mode&gt;</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mix-blend-mode""><code>mix-blend-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-blend-mode""><code>background-blend-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|compositing
"Defines how the browser distributes space between and around content items along the main-axis of a flex container, and the inline axis of a grid container"|justify-content|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-content|<br>The interactive example below demonstrates some of the values using Grid Layout<br>The alignment is done after the lengths and auto margins are applied, meaning that, if in a Flexbox layout there is at least one flexible element, with flex-grow different from 0, it will have no effect as there won't be any available space|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>flex containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>justify-content: center;     /* Pack items around the center */<br>justify-content: start;      /* Pack items from the start */<br>justify-content: end;        /* Pack items from the end */<br>justify-content: flex-start; /* Pack flex items from the start */<br>justify-content: flex-end;   /* Pack flex items from the end */<br>justify-content: left;       /* Pack items from the left */<br>justify-content: right;      /* Pack items from the right */<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>/* justify-content does not take baseline values */<br><br>/* Normal alignment */<br>justify-content: normal;<br><br>/* Distributed alignment */<br>justify-content: space-between; /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                   The first item is flush with the start,<br>                                   the last is flush with the end */<br>justify-content: space-around;  /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                   Items have a half-size space<br>                                   on either end */<br>justify-content: space-evenly;  /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                   Items have equal space around them */<br>justify-content: stretch;       /* Distribute items evenly<br>                                   Stretch 'auto'-sized items to fit<br>                                   the container */<br><br>/* Overflow alignment */<br>justify-content: safe center;<br>justify-content: unsafe center;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>justify-content: inherit;<br>justify-content: initial;<br>justify-content: revert;<br>justify-content: revert-layer;<br>justify-content: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Aligning_Items_in_a_Flex_Container"">Aligning items in a flex container</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br></ul>|css-align
"Defines the default justify-self for all items of the box, giving them all a default way of justifying each box along the appropriate axis"|justify-items|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-items|<br>The effect of this property is dependent of the layout mode we are in:<br>In block-level layouts, it aligns the items inside their containing block on the inline axis<br>For absolutely-positioned elements, it aligns the items inside their containing block on the inline axis, accounting for the offset values of top, left, bottom, and right<br>In table cell layouts, this property is ignored (more about alignment in block, absolute positioned and table layout)<br>In flexbox layouts, this property is ignored (more about alignment in Flexbox)<br>In grid layouts, it aligns the items inside their grid areas on the inline axis (more about alignment in grid layouts)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>legacy</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Basic keywords */<br>justify-items: normal;<br>justify-items: stretch;<br><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>justify-items: center;     /* Pack items around the center */<br>justify-items: start;      /* Pack items from the start */<br>justify-items: end;        /* Pack items from the end */<br>justify-items: flex-start; /* Equivalent to 'start'. Note that justify-items is ignored in Flexbox layouts. */<br>justify-items: flex-end;   /* Equivalent to 'end'. Note that justify-items is ignored in Flexbox layouts. */<br>justify-items: self-start;<br>justify-items: self-end;<br>justify-items: left;       /* Pack items from the left */<br>justify-items: right;      /* Pack items from the right */<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>justify-items: baseline;<br>justify-items: first baseline;<br>justify-items: last baseline;<br><br>/* Overflow alignment (for positional alignment only) */<br>justify-items: safe center;<br>justify-items: unsafe center;<br><br>/* Legacy alignment */<br>justify-items: legacy right;<br>justify-items: legacy left;<br>justify-items: legacy center;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>justify-items: inherit;<br>justify-items: initial;<br>justify-items: revert;<br>justify-items: revert-layer;<br>justify-items: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property can take one of four different forms:</p><br><ul><br><li>Basic keywords: one of the keyword values <code>normal</code> or <code>stretch</code>.</li><br><li>Baseline alignment: the <code>baseline</code> keyword, plus optionally one of <code>first</code> or <code>last</code>.</li><br><li>Positional alignment: one of: <code>center</code>, <code>start</code>, <code>end</code>, <code>flex-start</code>, <code>flex-end</code>, <code>self-start</code>, <code>self-end</code>, <code>left</code>, or <code>right</code>. Plus optionally <code>safe</code> or <code>unsafe</code>.</li><br><li>Legacy alignment: the <code>legacy</code> keyword, followed by one of <code>left</code> or <code>right</code>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/place-items""><code>place-items</code></a> shorthand property</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-self""><code>justify-self</code></a> property</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items""><code>align-items</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-align
"Sets the way a box is justified inside its alignment container along the appropriate axis"|justify-self|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-self|<br>The effect of this property is dependent of the layout mode we are in:<br>In block-level layouts, it aligns an item inside its containing block on the inline axis<br>For absolutely-positioned elements, it aligns an item inside its containing block on the inline axis, accounting for the offset values of top, left, bottom, and right<br>In table cell layouts, this property is ignored Read more about alignment in block, absolute positioned and table layout<br>In flexbox layouts, this property is ignored Read more about alignment in Flexbox<br>In grid layouts, it aligns an item inside its grid area on the inline axis Read more about alignment in grid layouts|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>block-level boxes, absolutely-positioned boxes, and grid items</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Basic keywords */<br>justify-self: auto;<br>justify-self: normal;<br>justify-self: stretch;<br><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>justify-self: center;     /* Pack item around the center */<br>justify-self: start;      /* Pack item from the start */<br>justify-self: end;        /* Pack item from the end */<br>justify-self: flex-start; /* Equivalent to 'start'. Note that justify-self is ignored in Flexbox layouts. */<br>justify-self: flex-end;   /* Equivalent to 'end'. Note that justify-self is ignored in Flexbox layouts. */<br>justify-self: self-start;<br>justify-self: self-end;<br>justify-self: left;       /* Pack item from the left */<br>justify-self: right;      /* Pack item from the right */<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>justify-self: baseline;<br>justify-self: first baseline;<br>justify-self: last baseline;<br><br>/* Overflow alignment (for positional alignment only) */<br>justify-self: safe center;<br>justify-self: unsafe center;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>justify-self: inherit;<br>justify-self: initial;<br>justify-self: revert;<br>justify-self: revert-layer;<br>justify-self: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property can take one of three different forms:</p><br><ul><br><li>Basic keywords: one of the keyword values <code>normal</code>, <code>auto</code>, or <code>stretch</code>.</li><br><li>Baseline alignment: the <code>baseline</code> keyword, plus optionally one of <code>first</code> or <code>last</code>.</li><br><li>Positional alignment:<br>    <ul><br><li>one of: <code>center</code>, <code>start</code>, <code>end</code>, <code>flex-start</code>, <code>flex-end</code>, <code>self-start</code>, <code>self-end</code>, <code>left</code>, or <code>right</code>.</li><br><li>Plus optionally <code>safe</code> or <code>unsafe</code>.</li><br></ul><br></li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-items""><code>justify-items</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-align
"Participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element"|left|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left| It has no effect on non-positioned elements|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>positioned elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>left: 3px;<br>left: 2.4em;<br><br>/* <percentage>s of the width of the containing block */<br>left: 10%;<br><br>/* Keyword value */<br>left: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>left: inherit;<br>left: initial;<br>left: revert;<br>left: revert-layer;<br>left: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset""><code>inset</code></a>, the shorthand for all related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/top""><code>top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/bottom""><code>bottom</code></a>, <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/left""><code>left</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/right""><code>right</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block-start""><code>inset-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block-end""><code>inset-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline-start""><code>inset-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline-end""><code>inset-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-block""><code>inset-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inset-inline""><code>inset-inline</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position""><code>position</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-position
"Sets the horizontal spacing behavior between text characters"|letter-spacing|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/letter-spacing| This value is added to the natural spacing between characters while rendering the text Positive values of letter-spacing causes characters to spread farther apart, while negative values of letter-spacing bring characters closer together|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>an optimum value consisting of either an absolute length or the keyword <code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>letter-spacing: normal;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>letter-spacing: 0.3em;<br>letter-spacing: 3px;<br>letter-spacing: 0.3px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>letter-spacing: inherit;<br>letter-spacing: initial;<br>letter-spacing: revert;<br>letter-spacing: revert-layer;<br>letter-spacing: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-kerning""><code>font-kerning</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/word-spacing""><code>word-spacing</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-text
"Sets how to break lines of Chinese, Japanese, or Korean (CJK) text when working with punctuation and symbols"|line-break|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/line-break||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>line-break: auto;<br>line-break: loose;<br>line-break: normal;<br>line-break: strict;<br>line-break: anywhere;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>line-break: inherit;<br>line-break: initial;<br>line-break: revert;<br>line-break: revert-layer;<br>line-break: unset;<br><br></pre><br>||css-text
"Sets the height of a line box"|line-height|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/line-height| It's commonly used to set the distance between lines of text On block-level elements, it specifies the minimum height of line boxes within the element On non-replaced inline elements, it specifies the height that is used to calculate line box height|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the font size of the element itself</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>for percentage and length values, the absolute length, otherwise as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>either number or length</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>line-height: normal;<br><br>/* Unitless values: use this number multiplied<br>by the element's font size */<br>line-height: 3.5;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>line-height: 3em;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>line-height: 34%;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>line-height: inherit;<br>line-height: initial;<br>line-height: revert;<br>line-height: revert-layer;<br>line-height: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>line-height</code> property is specified as any one of the following:</p><br><ul><br><li>a <code>&lt;number&gt;</code></li><br><li>a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code></li><br><li>a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></li><br><li>the keyword <code>normal</code>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font""><code>font</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size""><code>font-size</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-inline
"Allows you to set all the list style properties at once"|list-style|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style|<br>Note: This property is applied to list items, ie, elements with display: list-item; By default this includes <li> elements Because this property is inherited, it can be set on a parent element (normally <ol> or <ul>) to make the same list styling apply to all the items inside|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* type */<br>list-style: square;<br><br>/* image */<br>list-style: url(""../img/shape.png"");<br><br>/* position */<br>list-style: inside;<br><br>/* type | position */<br>list-style: georgian inside;<br><br>/* type | image | position */<br>list-style: lower-roman url(""../img/shape.png"") outside;<br><br>/* Keyword value */<br>list-style: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>list-style: inherit;<br>list-style: initial;<br>list-style: revert;<br>list-style: revert-layer;<br>list-style: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>list-style</code> property is specified as one, two, or three keywords in any order. If <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type""><code>list-style-type</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-image""><code>list-style-image</code></a> are both set, then <code>list-style-type</code> is used as a fallback if the image is unavailable.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type""><code>list-style-type</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-image""><code>list-style-image</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-position""><code>list-style-position</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-lists

"Sets the position of the ::marker relative to a list item"|list-style-position|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-position|<br>It is often more convenient to use the shorthand list-style<br>Note: This property is applied to list items, ie, elements with display: list-item; By default this includes <li> elements Because this property is inherited, it can be set on the parent element (normally <ol> or <ul>) to let it apply to all list items<br>Note that there is variance among browsers regarding behavior when a block element is placed first within a list element declared as list-style-position: inside Chrome and Safari both place this element on the same line as the marker box, whereas Firefox, Internet Explorer, and Opera place it on the next line For more information on this, see bug36854|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>outside</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>list items</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>list-style-position: inside;<br>list-style-position: outside;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>list-style-position: inherit;<br>list-style-position: initial;<br>list-style-position: revert;<br>list-style-position: revert-layer;<br>list-style-position: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>list-style-position</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style""><code>list-style</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type""><code>list-style-type</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-image""><code>list-style-image</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-lists
"Sets the marker (such as a disc, character, or custom counter style) of a list item element"|list-style-type|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-type|<br>The color of the marker will be the same as the computed color of the element it applies to<br>Only a few elements (<li> and <summary>) have a default value of display: list-item However, the list-style-type property may be applied to any element whose display value is set to list-item Moreover, because this property is inherited, it can be set on a parent element (commonly <ol> or <ul>) to make it apply to all list items|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>disc</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>list items</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Partial list of types */<br>list-style-type: disc;<br>list-style-type: circle;<br>list-style-type: square;<br>list-style-type: decimal;<br>list-style-type: georgian;<br>list-style-type: trad-chinese-informal;<br>list-style-type: kannada;<br><br>/* <string> value */<br>list-style-type: ""-"";<br><br>/* Identifier matching an @counter-style rule */<br>list-style-type: custom-counter-style;<br><br>/* Keyword value */<br>list-style-type: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>list-style-type: inherit;<br>list-style-type: initial;<br>list-style-type: revert;<br>list-style-type: revert-layer;<br>list-style-type: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>list-style-type</code> property may be defined as any one of:</p><br><ul><br><li>a <code>&lt;custom-ident&gt;</code> value</li><br><li>a <code>symbols()</code> value</li><br><li>a <code>&lt;string&gt;</code> value</li><br><li>the keyword <code>none</code>.</li><br></ul><br><p>Note that:</p><br><ul><br><li>Some types require a suitable font installed to display as expected.</li><br><li>The <code>cjk-ideographic</code> is identical to <code>trad-chinese-informal</code>; it exists for legacy reasons.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style""><code>list-style</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-image""><code>list-style-image</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style-position""><code>list-style-position</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-lists
"Sets the margin area on all four sides of an element"|margin|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>: <code>0</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except elements with table <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a> types other than <code>table-caption</code>, <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Apply to all four sides */<br>margin: 1em;<br>margin: -3px;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>margin: 5% auto;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>margin: 1em auto 2em;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>margin: 2px 1em 0 auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin: inherit;<br>margin: initial;<br>margin: revert;<br>margin: revert-layer;<br>margin: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>margin</code> property may be specified using one, two, three, or four values. Each value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a>, a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a>, or the keyword <code>auto</code>. Negative values draw the element closer to its neighbors than it would be by default.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same margin to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first margin applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first margin applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>right and left</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the margins apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">Introduction to the CSS basic box model</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Mastering_margin_collapsing"">Margin collapsing</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block""><code>margin-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline""><code>margin-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Defines the logical block start and end margins of an element, which maps to physical margins depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|margin-block|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>: <code>0</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>depends on layout model</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-block: 10px 20px;  /* An absolute length */<br>margin-block: 1em 2em;    /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-block: 5% 2%;      /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br>margin-block: 10px;       /* sets both start and end values */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-block: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-block: inherit;<br>margin-block: initial;<br>margin-block: revert;<br>margin-block: revert-layer;<br>margin-block: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property corresponds to the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, or the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a> properties, depending on the values defined for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>.</p><br><p>The <code>margin-block</code> property may be specified using one or two values.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same margin to <strong>both start and end</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first margin applies to the <strong>start</strong>, the second to the <strong>end</strong>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, "Defines the logical block end margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|margin-block-end|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>.</p><br><p>It relates to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a>, which define the other margins of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a "Sets the margin area on the bottom of an element"|margin-bottom|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom| A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer<br><br>This property has no effect on non-replaced inline elements, such as <span> or <code>|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except elements with table <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a> types other than <code>table-caption</code>, <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-bottom: 10px;  /* An absolute length */<br>margin-bottom: 1em;   /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-bottom: 5%;    /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-bottom: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-bottom: inherit;<br>margin-bottom: initial;<br>margin-bottom: revert;<br>margin-bottom: revert-layer;<br>margin-bottom: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>margin-bottom</code> property is specified as the keyword <code>auto</code>, or a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code>, or a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code>. Its value can be positive, zero, or negative.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a> shorthand</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block""><code>margin-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline""><code>margin-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Is a shorthand property that defines both the logical inline start and end margins of an element, which maps to physical margins depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|margin-inline|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a>: <code>0</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>depends on layout model</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a>: if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-inline: 10px 20px;  /* An absolute length */<br>margin-inline: 1em 2em;    /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-inline: 5% 2%;      /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br>margin-inline: 10px;       /* sets both start and end values */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-inline: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-inline: inherit;<br>margin-inline: initial;<br>margin-inline: revert;<br>margin-inline: revert-layer;<br>margin-inline: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>This property corresponds to the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, or the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a> properties, depending on the values defined for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a>.</p><br><p>The <code>margin-inline</code> property may be specified using one or two values.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same margin to <strong>both start and end</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first margin applies to the <strong>start</strong>, the second to the <strong>end</strong>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines the logical inline end margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|margin-inline-end|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end| In other words, it corresponds to the margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom or margin-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>depends on layout model</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-inline-end: 10px;   /* An absolute length */<br>margin-inline-end: 1em;    /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-inline-end: 5%;     /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-inline-end: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-inline-end: inherit;<br>margin-inline-end: initial;<br>margin-inline-end: revert;<br>margin-inline-end: revert-layer;<br>margin-inline-end: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>It relates to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, which define the other margins of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines the logical inline start margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|margin-inline-start|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start| It corresponds to the margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, or margin-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>depends on layout model</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>if specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, <code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-inline-start: 10px;  /* An absolute length */<br>margin-inline-start: 1em;   /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-inline-start: 5%;    /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-inline-start: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-inline-start: inherit;<br>margin-inline-start: initial;<br>margin-inline-start: revert;<br>margin-inline-start: revert-layer;<br>margin-inline-start: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>It relates to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a>, which define the other margins of the element.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Sets the margin area on the left side of an element"|margin-left|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left| A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer<br>The vertical margins of two adjacent boxes may fuse This is called margin collapsing<br>In the rare cases where width is overconstrained (ie, when all of width, margin-left, border, padding, the content area, and margin-right are defined), margin-left is ignored, and will have the same calculated value as if the auto value was specified|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except elements with table <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a> types other than <code>table-caption</code>, <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-left: 10px;  /* An absolute length */<br>margin-left: 1em;   /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-left: 5%;    /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-left: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-left: inherit;<br>margin-left: initial;<br>margin-left: revert;<br>margin-left: revert-layer;<br>margin-left: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>margin-left</code> property is specified as the keyword <code>auto</code>, or a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code>, or a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code>. Its value can be positive, zero, or negative.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a> shorthand</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block""><code>margin-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline""><code>margin-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Sets the margin area on the right side of an element"|margin-right|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right| A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer<br>The vertical margins of two adjacent boxes may fuse This is called margin collapsing|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except elements with table <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a> types other than <code>table-caption</code>, <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code>. Its value can be positive, zero, or negative.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top""><code>margin-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a> shorthand</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block""><code>margin-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline""><code>margin-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Sets the margin area on the top of an element"|margin-top|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-top| A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer<br>This property has no effect on non-replaced inline elements, such as <span> or <code>|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except elements with table <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a> types other than <code>table-caption</code>, <code>table</code> and <code>inline-table</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>margin-top: 10px;  /* An absolute length */<br>margin-top: 1em;   /* relative to the text size */<br>margin-top: 5%;    /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>margin-top: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>margin-top: inherit;<br>margin-top: initial;<br>margin-top: revert;<br>margin-top: revert-layer;<br>margin-top: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>margin-top</code> property is specified as the keyword <code>auto</code>, or a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code>, or a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code>. Its value can be positive, zero, or negative.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-right""><code>margin-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-bottom""><code>margin-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-left""><code>margin-left</code></a> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin</code></a> shorthand</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-start""><code>margin-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block-end""><code>margin-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-start""><code>margin-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline-end""><code>margin-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-block""><code>margin-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin-inline""><code>margin-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Hides an element (partially or fully) by masking or clipping the image at specific points"|mask|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask|<br><br>Note: As well as the properties listed below, the mask shorthand also resets mask-border to its initial value It is therefore recommended to use the mask shorthand rather than other shorthands or the individual properties to override any mask settings earlier in the cascade This will ensure that mask-border has also been reset to allow the new styles to take effect|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-image""><code>mask-image</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-position""><code>mask-position</code></a>: <code>center</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-composite""><code>mask-composite</code></a>: <code>add</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-position""><code>mask-position</code></a>: refer to size of mask painting area minus size of mask layer image (see the text for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position""><code>background-position</code></a>)</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-image""><code>mask-image</code></a>: as specified, but with <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-mode""><code>mask-mode</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-repeat""><code>mask-repeat</code></a>: Consists of two keywords, one per dimension</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-position""><code>mask-position</code></a>: Consists of two keywords representing the origin and two offsets from that origin, each given as an absolute length (if given a &lt;length&gt;), otherwise as a percentage.</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-clip""><code>mask-clip</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-origin""><code>mask-origin</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-size""><code>mask-size</code></a>: as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-composite""><code>mask-composite</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-image""><code>mask-image</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-position""><code>mask-position</code></a>: repeatable list of simple list of length, percentage, or calc</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-clip""><code>mask-clip</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-origin""><code>mask-origin</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-composite""><code>mask-composite</code></a>: discrete</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Creates <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Positioning/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context"">stacking context</a></th><td>yes</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>mask: none;<br><br>/* Image values */<br>mask: url(mask.png);                       /* Pixel image used as mask */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star);                 /* Element within SVG graphic used as mask */<br><br>/* Combined values */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) luminance;       /* Element within SVG graphic used as luminance mask */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) 40px 20px;       /* Element within SVG graphic used as mask positioned 40px from the top and 20px from the left */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) 0 0/50px 50px;   /* Element within SVG graphic used as mask with a width and height of 50px */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) repeat-x;        /* Element within SVG graphic used as horizontally repeated mask */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) stroke-box;      /* Element within SVG graphic used as mask extending to the box enclosed by the stroke */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) exclude;         /* Element within SVG graphic used as mask and combined with background using non-overlapping parts */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask: inherit;<br>mask: initial;<br>mask: revert;<br>mask: revert-layer;<br>mask: unset;<br><br>/* Multiple masks */<br>mask: url(masks.svg#star) left / 16px repeat-y,    /* Element within SVG graphic is used as a mask on the left-hand side with a width of 16px */<br>      url(masks.svg#circle) right / 16px repeat-y; /* Element within SVG graphic is used as a mask on the right-hand side with a width of 16px */<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a "Lets you create a mask along the edge of an element's border"|mask-border|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a
