"Specifies the blending mode used in a mask border"|mask-border-mode|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-mode||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>alpha</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>mask-border-mode: luminance;<br>mask-border-mode: alpha;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask-border-mode: inherit;<br>mask-border-mode: initial;<br>mask-border-mode: revert;<br>mask-border-mode: revert-layer;<br>mask-border-mode: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border""><code>mask-border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-outset""><code>mask-border-outset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-repeat""><code>mask-border-repeat</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-source""><code>mask-border-source</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-width""><code>mask-border-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|compatibility
"Specifies the distance by which an element's mask border is set out from its border box"|mask-border-outset|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-outset||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> value */<br>mask-border-outset: 1rem;<br><br>/* <number> value */<br>mask-border-outset: 1.5;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>mask-border-outset: 1 1.2;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>mask-border-outset: 30px 2 45px;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>mask-border-outset: 7px 12px 14px 5px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask-border-outset: inherit;<br>mask-border-outset: initial;<br>mask-border-outset: revert;<br>mask-border-outset: revert-layer;<br>mask-border-outset: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>mask-border-outset</code> property may be specified as one, two, three, or four values. Each value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a>. Negative values are invalid.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same outset to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first outset applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first outset applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the outsets apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border""><code>mask-border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-mode""><code>mask-border-mode</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-repeat""><code>mask-border-repeat</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-source""><code>mask-border-source</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-width""><code>mask-border-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"Sets how the edge regions of a source image are adjusted to fit the dimensions of an element's mask border"|mask-border-repeat|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-repeat||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>stretch</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>mask-border-repeat: stretch;<br>mask-border-repeat: repeat;<br>mask-border-repeat: round;<br>mask-border-repeat: space;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>mask-border-repeat: round stretch;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask-border-repeat: inherit;<br>mask-border-repeat: initial;<br>mask-border-repeat: revert;<br>mask-border-repeat: revert-layer;<br>mask-border-repeat: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>mask-border-repeat</code> property may be specified using one or two values chosen from the list of values below.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same behavior on <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border""><code>mask-border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-mode""><code>mask-border-mode</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-outset""><code>mask-border-outset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-source""><code>mask-border-source</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-width""><code>mask-border-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"Divides the image set by mask-border-source into regions"|mask-border-slice|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-slice| These regions are used to form the components of an element's mask border|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to size of the mask border image</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* All sides */<br>mask-border-slice: 30%;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>mask-border-slice: 10% 30%;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>mask-border-slice: 30 30% 45;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>mask-border-slice: 7 12 14 5;<br><br>/* Using the `fill` keyword */<br>mask-border-slice: 10% fill 7 12;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask-border-slice: inherit;<br>mask-border-slice: initial;<br>mask-border-slice: revert;<br>mask-border-slice: revert-layer;<br>mask-border-slice: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>mask-border-slice</code> property may be specified using one to four <code>&lt;number-percentage&gt;</code> values to represent the position of each image slice. Negative values are invalid; values greater than their corresponding dimension are clamped to <code>100%</code>.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> position is specified, it creates all four slices at the same distance from their respective sides.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> positions are specified, the first value creates slices measured from the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second creates slices measured from the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> positions are specified, the first value creates a slice measured from the <strong>top</strong>, the second creates slices measured from the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third creates a slice measured from the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> positions are specified, they create slices measured from the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul><br><p>The optional <code>fill</code> value, if used, can be placed anywhere in the declaration.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border""><code>mask-border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-mode""><code>mask-border-mode</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-outset""><code>mask-border-outset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-repeat""><code>mask-border-repeat</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-source""><code>mask-border-source</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-width""><code>mask-border-width</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Shorthand_properties#tricky_edge_cases"">Illustrated description of the 1-to-4-value syntax</a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"Sets the source image used to create an element's mask border"|mask-border-source|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-source|<br>The mask-border-slice property is used to divide the source image into regions, which are then dynamically applied to the final mask border|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/url""><code>url()</code></a> values made absolute</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>mask-border-source: none;<br><br>/* <image> values */<br>mask-border-source: url(image.jpg);<br>mask-border-source: linear-gradient(to top, red, yellow);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask-border-source: inherit;<br>mask-border-source: initial;<br>mask-border-source: revert;<br>mask-border-source: revert-layer;<br>mask-border-source: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border""><code>mask-border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-mode""><code>mask-border-mode</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-outset""><code>mask-border-outset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-repeat""><code>mask-border-repeat</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-width""><code>mask-border-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"Sets the width of an element's mask border"|mask-border-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-width||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>relative to width/height of the mask border image area</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>mask-border-width: auto;<br><br>/* <length> value */<br>mask-border-width: 1rem;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>mask-border-width: 25%;<br><br>/* <number> value */<br>mask-border-width: 3;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>mask-border-width: 2em 3em;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>mask-border-width: 5% 15% 10%;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>mask-border-width: 5% 2em 10% auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mask-border-width: inherit;<br>mask-border-width: initial;<br>mask-border-width: revert;<br>mask-border-width: revert-layer;<br>mask-border-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>mask-border-width</code> property may be specified using one, two, three, or four values chosen from the list of values below.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same width to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first width applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first width applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the widths apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border""><code>mask-border</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-mode""><code>mask-border-mode</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-outset""><code>mask-border-outset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-repeat""><code>mask-border-repeat</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-border-source""><code>mask-border-source</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"Specifies the maximum size of an element in the direction opposite that of the writing direction as specified by writing-mode"|max-block-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-block-size| That is, if the writing direction is horizontal, then max-block-size is equivalent to max-height; if the writing direction is vertical, max-block-size is the same as max-width<br>The other dimension's maximum length is specified using the max-inline-size property<br>This is useful because the max-width is always used for horizontal sizes and max-height is always used for vertical sizes, and if you need to set lengths based on the size of your text content, you need to be able to do so with the writing direction in mind<br>Any time you would normally use max-height or max-width, you should instead use max-block-size to set the maximum ""height"" of the content (even though this may not be a vertical value) and max-inline-size to set the maximum ""width"" of the content (although this may instead be vertical rather than horizontal) See the Example in writing-mode, which shows the different writing modes in action|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>block-size of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width""><code>max-width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height""><code>max-height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>max-block-size: 300px;<br>max-block-size: 25em;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>max-block-size: 75%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>max-block-size: none;<br>max-block-size: max-content;<br>max-block-size: min-content;<br>max-block-size: fit-content(20em);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>max-block-size: inherit;<br>max-block-size: initial;<br>max-block-size: revert;<br>max-block-size: revert-layer;<br>max-block-size: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width""><code>max-width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height""><code>max-height</code></a></li><br><li>Setting the other direction's maximum size: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-inline-size""><code>max-inline-size</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Sets the maximum height of an element"|max-height|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height| It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-height<br>max-height overrides height, but min-height overrides max-height|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements but non-replaced inline elements, table columns, and column groups</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>The percentage is calculated with respect to the height of the generated box's containing block. If the height of the containing block is not specified explicitly (i.e., it depends on content height), and this element is not absolutely positioned, the percentage value is treated as <code>none</code>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length or <code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> value */<br>max-height: 3.5em;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>max-height: 75%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>max-height: none;<br>max-height: max-content;<br>max-height: min-content;<br>max-height: fit-content(20em);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>max-height: inherit;<br>max-height: initial;<br>max-height: revert;<br>max-height: revert-layer;<br>max-height: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">The box model</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-sizing""><code>box-sizing</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-height""><code>min-height</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-inline-size""><code>max-inline-size</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-block-size""><code>max-block-size</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-sizing-4
"Defines the horizontal or vertical maximum size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode"|max-inline-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-inline-size| It corresponds to either the max-width or the max-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode<br>If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of max-inline-size relates to the maximal height of the element; otherwise, it relates to the maximal width of the element A related property is max-block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>inline-size of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width""><code>max-width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height""><code>max-height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>max-inline-size: 300px;<br>max-inline-size: 25em;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>max-inline-size: 75%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>max-inline-size: none;<br>max-inline-size: max-content;<br>max-inline-size: min-content;<br>max-inline-size: fit-content(20em);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>max-inline-size: inherit;<br>max-inline-size: initial;<br>max-inline-size: revert;<br>max-inline-size: revert-layer;<br>max-inline-size: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width""><code>max-width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height""><code>max-height</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Sets the maximum width of an element"|max-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width| It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming larger than the value specified by max-width<br>max-width overrides width, but min-width overrides max-width|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements but non-replaced inline elements, table rows, and row groups</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length or <code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> value */<br>max-width: 3.5em;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>max-width: 75%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>max-width: none;<br>max-width: max-content;<br>max-width: min-content;<br>max-width: fit-content(20em);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>max-width: inherit;<br>max-width: initial;<br>max-width: revert;<br>max-width: revert-layer;<br>max-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">The box model</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-sizing""><code>box-sizing</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-width""><code>min-width</code></a></li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-inline-size""><code>max-inline-size</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-block-size""><code>max-block-size</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-sizing-4
"Defines the minimum horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode"|min-block-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-block-size| It corresponds to either the min-width or the min-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode<br>If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of min-block-size relates to the minimum width of the element; otherwise, it relates to the minimum height of the element A related property is min-inline-size, which defines the other dimension of the element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/width""><code>width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>block-size of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>same as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-width""><code>min-width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-height""><code>min-height</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>min-block-size: 100px;<br>min-block-size: 5em;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>min-block-size: 10%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>min-block-size: max-content;<br>min-block-size: min-content;<br>min-block-size: fit-content(20em);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>min-block-size: inherit;<br>min-block-size: initial;<br>min-block-size: revert;<br>min-block-size: revert-layer;<br>min-block-size: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-width""><code>min-width</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-height""><code>min-height</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Sets the minimum height of an element"|min-height|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/min-height| It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height<br>The element's height is set to the value of min-height whenever min-height is larger than max-height or height|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements but non-replaced inline elements, table columns, and column groups</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>The percentage is calculated with respect to the height of the generated box's containing block. If the height of the containing block is not specified explicitly (i.e., it depends on content height), and this element is not absolutely positioned, the percentage value is treated as <code>0</code>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> value */<br>min-height: 3.5em;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>min-height: 10%;<br><br>/* Keyword values */<br>min-height: max-content;<br>min-height: min-content;<br>min-height: fit-content(20em);<br><br>/* Global values */<br>min-height: inherit;<br>min-height: initial;<br>min-height: revert;<br>min-height: revert-layer;<br>min-height: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">The box model</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/box-sizing""><code>box-sizing</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/height""><code>height</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-height""><code>max-height</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-sizing

"Sets how an element's content should blend with the content of the element's parent and the element's background"|mix-blend-mode|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mix-blend-mode||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Creates <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Positioning/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context"">stacking context</a></th><td>yes</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>mix-blend-mode: normal;<br>mix-blend-mode: multiply;<br>mix-blend-mode: screen;<br>mix-blend-mode: overlay;<br>mix-blend-mode: darken;<br>mix-blend-mode: lighten;<br>mix-blend-mode: color-dodge;<br>mix-blend-mode: color-burn;<br>mix-blend-mode: hard-light;<br>mix-blend-mode: soft-light;<br>mix-blend-mode: difference;<br>mix-blend-mode: exclusion;<br>mix-blend-mode: hue;<br>mix-blend-mode: saturation;<br>mix-blend-mode: color;<br>mix-blend-mode: luminosity;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>mix-blend-mode: inherit;<br>mix-blend-mode: initial;<br>mix-blend-mode: revert;<br>mix-blend-mode: revert-layer;<br>mix-blend-mode: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/blend-mode""><code>&lt;blend-mode&gt;</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-blend-mode""><code>background-blend-mode</code></a></li><br></ul>|compositing
"Sets how the content of a replaced element, such as an <img> or <video>, should be resized to fit its container"|object-fit|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit|<br>You can alter the alignment of the replaced element's content object within the element's box using the object-position property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>fill</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>replaced elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>object-fit: contain;<br>object-fit: cover;<br>object-fit: fill;<br>object-fit: none;<br>object-fit: scale-down;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>object-fit: inherit;<br>object-fit: initial;<br>object-fit: revert;<br>object-fit: revert-layer;<br>object-fit: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>object-fit</code> property is specified as a single keyword chosen from the list of values below.</p>|<ul><br><li>Other image-related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-position""><code>object-position</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/image-orientation""><code>image-orientation</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/image-rendering""><code>image-rendering</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/image-resolution""><code>image-resolution</code></a>.</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size""><code>background-size</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-images

href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;position&gt; data type are interpolated independently for the abscissa and ordinate. As the speed is defined by the same &lt;timing-function&gt; for both, the point will move following a line."">position</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path""><code>offset-path</code></a>: as &lt;angle&gt;, &lt;basic-shape&gt; or &lt;path()&gt;</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-distance""><code>offset-distance</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-anchor""><code>offset-anchor</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;position&gt; data type are interpolated independently for the abscissa and ordinate. As the speed is defined by the same &lt;timing-function&gt; for both, the point will move following a line."">position</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-rotate""><code>offset-rotate</code></a>: as &lt;angle&gt;, &lt;basic-shape&gt; or &lt;path()&gt;</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Creates <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Positioning/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context"">stacking context</a></th><td>yes</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Offset position */<br>offset: auto;<br>offset: 10px 30px;<br>offset: none;<br><br>/* Offset path */<br>offset: ray(45deg closest-side);<br>offset: path(""M 100 100 L 300 100 L 200 300 z"");<br>offset: url(arc.svg);<br><br>/* Offset path with distance and/or rotation */<br>offset: url(circle.svg) 100px;<br>offset: url(circle.svg) 40%;<br>offset: url(circle.svg) 30deg;<br>offset: url(circle.svg) 50px 20deg;<br><br>/* Including offset anchor */<br>offset: ray(45deg closest-side) / 40px 20px;<br>offset: url(arc.svg) 2cm / 0.5cm 3cm;<br>offset: url(arc.svg) 30deg / 50px 100px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>offset: inherit;<br>offset: initial;<br>offset: revert;<br>offset: revert-layer;<br>offset: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-anchor""><code>offset-anchor</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-distance""><code>offset-distance</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path""><code>offset-path</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-position""><code>offset-position</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-rotate""><code>offset-rotate</code></a></li><br></ul>|motion
"Specifies the point inside the box of an element traveling along an offset-path that is actually moving along the path"|offset-anchor|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-anchor||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>relativeToWidthAndHeight</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> the absolute value, otherwise a percentage</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;position&gt; data type are interpolated independently for the abscissa and ordinate. As the speed is defined by the same &lt;timing-function&gt; for both, the point will move following a line."">position</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>offset-anchor: top;<br>offset-anchor: bottom;<br>offset-anchor: left;<br>offset-anchor: right;<br>offset-anchor: center;<br>offset-anchor: auto;<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>offset-anchor: 25% 75%;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>offset-anchor: 0 0;<br>offset-anchor: 1cm 2cm;<br>offset-anchor: 10ch 8em;<br><br>/* Edge offsets values */<br>offset-anchor: bottom 10px right 20px;<br>offset-anchor: right 3em bottom 10px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>offset-anchor: inherit;<br>offset-anchor: initial;<br>offset-anchor: revert;<br>offset-anchor: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset""><code>offset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-distance""><code>offset-distance</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-rotate""><code>offset-rotate</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Tutorial/Paths"">SVG <code>&lt;path&gt;</code></a></li><br></ul>|motion
"Specifies a position along an offset-path for an element to be placed"|offset-distance|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-distance||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the total path length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> the absolute value, otherwise a percentage</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;percentage&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">percentage</a> or calc();</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Default value */<br>offset-distance: 0;<br><br>/* the middle of the offset-path */<br>offset-distance: 50%;<br><br>/* a fixed length positioned along the path */<br>offset-distance: 40px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>offset-distance: inherit;<br>offset-distance: initial;<br>offset-distance: revert;<br>offset-distance: revert-layer;<br>offset-distance: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><dl><br><dt id=""length-percentage""><code><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length-percentage""><code>&lt;length-percentage&gt;</code></a></code></dt><br><dd><br><p>A length that specifies how far the element is along the path (defined with <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path""><code>offset-path</code></a>).</p><br><p>100% represents the total length of the path (when the <code>offset-path</code> is defined as a basic shape or <code>path()</code>).</p><br></dd><br></dl>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset""><code>offset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-anchor""><code>offset-anchor</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path""><code>offset-path</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-position""><code>offset-position</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-rotate""><code>offset-rotate</code></a></li><br></ul>|motion
"Specifies a motion path for an element to follow and defines the element's positioning within the parent container or SVG coordinate system"|offset-path|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as &lt;angle&gt;, &lt;basic-shape&gt; or &lt;path()&gt;</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Creates <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Positioning/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context"">stacking context</a></th><td>yes</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Default */<br>offset-path: none;<br><br>/* Function values */<br>offset-path: ray(45deg closest-side contain);<br><br>/* URL */<br>offset-path: url(#path);<br><br>/* Shapes */<br>offset-path: circle(50% at 25% 25%);<br>offset-path: inset(50% 50% 50% 50%);<br>offset-path: polygon(30% 0%, 70% 0%, 100% 50%, 30% 100%, 0% 70%, 0% 30%);<br>offset-path: path(""M 0,200 Q 200,200 260,80 Q 290,20 400,0 Q 300,100 400,200"");<br><br>/* Geometry Boxes */<br>offset-path: margin-box;<br>offset-path: stroke-box;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>offset-path: inherit;<br>offset-path: initial;<br>offset-path: revert;<br>offset-path: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset""><code>offset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-distance""><code>offset-distance</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-rotate""><code>offset-rotate</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Tutorial/Paths"">SVG &lt;path&gt;</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/path""><code>path()</code></a></li><br></ul><br><p>Other demos:</p><br><ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://codepen.io/team/css-tricks/pen/WZdKMq"" rel=""noopener"">Examples of the various values</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://codepen.io/ericwilligers/pen/jMbJPp"" rel=""noopener"">Triangle</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://codepen.io/ericwilligers/pen/bwVZNa"" rel=""noopener"">Scissors</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://jsfiddle.net/ericwilligers/r1snqdan/"" rel=""noopener"">Eyes</a></li><br></ul>|motion
"Defines the orientation/direction of the element as it is positioned along the offset-path"|offset-rotate|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-rotate|<br>Note: Early versions of the spec called this property motion-rotation|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as &lt;angle&gt;, &lt;basic-shape&gt; or &lt;path()&gt;</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Follow the path direction, with optional additional angle */<br>offset-rotate: auto;<br>offset-rotate: auto 45deg;<br><br>/* Follow the path direction but facing the opposite direction of `auto` */<br>offset-rotate: reverse;<br><br>/* Keep a constant rotation regardless the position on the path */<br>offset-rotate: 90deg;<br>offset-rotate: 0.5turn;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>offset-rotate: inherit;<br>offset-rotate: initial;<br>offset-rotate: revert;<br>offset-rotate: revert-layer;<br>offset-rotate: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><dl><br><dt id=""auto""><code>auto</code></dt><br><dd><br><p>The element is rotated by the angle of the direction of the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path""><code>offset-path</code></a>, relative to the positive x-axis. This is the default value.</p><br></dd><br><dt id=""angle""><code><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/angle""><code>&lt;angle&gt;</code></a></code></dt><br><dd><br><p>The element has a constant clockwise rotation transformation applied to it by the specified rotation angle.</p><br></dd><br><dt id=""auto_angle""><code>auto &lt;angle&gt;</code></dt><br><dd><br><p>If <code>auto</code> is followed by an <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/angle""><code>&lt;angle&gt;</code></a>, the computed value of the angle is added to the computed value of <code>auto</code>.</p><br></dd><br><dt id=""reverse""><code>reverse</code></dt><br><dd><br><p>The element is rotated similar to <code>auto</code>, except it faces the opposite direction. It is the same as specifying a value of <code>auto 180deg</code>.</p><br></dd><br></dl>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset""><code>offset</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-anchor""><code>offset-anchor</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-distance""><code>offset-distance</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path""><code>offset-path</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/offset-position""><code>offset-position</code></a></li><br></ul>|motion
"Sets the opacity of an element"|opacity|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/opacity| Opacity is the degree to which content behind an element is hidden, and is the opposite of transparency|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>1</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>map to the range <code>[0,1]</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>The same as the specified value after clipping the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a> to the range [0.0, 1.0].</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>opacity: 0.9;<br>opacity: 90%;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>opacity: inherit;<br>opacity: initial;<br>opacity: revert;<br>opacity: revert-layer;<br>opacity: unset;<br><br></pre><br>||css-color
"Sets the order to lay out an item in a flex or grid container"|order|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/order| Items in a container are sorted by ascending order value and then by their source code order|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>Flex items, grid items, and absolutely-positioned flex and grid container children</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>an <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/integer#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;integer&gt; CSS data type are interpolated via integer discrete steps. The calculation is done as if they were real, floating-point numbers and the discrete value is obtained using the floor function."">integer</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <integer> values */<br>order: 5;<br>order: -5;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>order: inherit;<br>order: initial;<br>order: revert;<br>order: revert-layer;<br>order: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>Since <code>order</code> is only meant to affect the <em>visual order</em> of elements and not their logical or tab order. <code>order</code> must not be used on non-visual media such as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media#speech"">speech</a>.</p>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Ordering_Flex_Items"">Ordering flex items</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/CSS_Grid_Layout_and_Accessibility"">CSS Grid Layout and accessibility</a></em></li><br></ul>|css-display
"Sets most of the outline properties in a single declaration"|outline|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>: <code>invert</code>, for browsers supporting it, <code>currentColor</code> for the other</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-style""><code>outline-style</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-width""><code>outline-width</code></a>: <code>medium</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>: For the keyword <code>invert</code>, the computed value is <code>invert</code>. For the color value, if the value is translucent, the computed value will be the <code>rgba()</code> corresponding one. If it isn't, it will be the <code>rgb()</code> corresponding one. The <code>transparent</code> keyword maps to <code>rgba(0,0,0,0)</code>.</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-width""><code>outline-width</code></a>: an absolute length; if the keyword <code>none</code> is specified, the computed value is <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-style""><code>outline-style</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-width""><code>outline-width</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-style""><code>outline-style</code></a>: discrete</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* style */<br>outline: solid;<br><br>/* color | style */<br>outline: #f66 dashed;<br><br>/* style | width */<br>outline: inset thick;<br><br>/* color | style | width */<br>outline: green solid 3px;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>outline: inherit;<br>outline: initial;<br>outline: revert;<br>outline: revert-layer;<br>outline: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>outline</code> property may be specified using one, two, or three of the values listed below. The order of the values does not matter. As with all shorthand properties, any omitted sub-values will be set to their <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">initial value</a>.</p><br><div class=""notecard note"" id=""sect1""><br><p><strong>Note:</strong> The outline will be invisible for many elements if its style is not defined. This is because the style defaults to <code>none</code>. A notable exception is <code>input</code> elements, which are given default styling by browsers.</p><br></div>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-style""><code>outline-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-width""><code>outline-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-ui
"Sets the color of an element's outline"|outline-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>invert</code>, for browsers supporting it, <code>currentColor</code> for the other</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>For the keyword <code>invert</code>, the computed value is <code>invert</code>. For the color value, if the value is translucent, the computed value will be the <code>rgba()</code> corresponding one. If it isn't, it will be the <code>rgb()</code> corresponding one. The <code>transparent</code> keyword maps to <code>rgba(0,0,0,0)</code>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <color> values */<br>outline-color: #f92525;<br>outline-color: rgb(30, 222, 121);<br>outline-color: blue;<br><br>/* Keyword value */<br>outline-color: invert;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>outline-color: inherit;<br>outline-color: initial;<br>outline-color: revert;<br>outline-color: revert-layer;<br>outline-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>outline-color</code> property is specified as "Sets the amount of space between an outline and the edge or border of an element"|outline-offset|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-offset||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>outline-offset: 3px;<br>outline-offset: 0.2em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>outline-offset: inherit;<br>outline-offset: initial;<br>outline-offset: revert;<br>outline-offset: revert-layer;<br>outline-offset: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline""><code>outline</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-style""><code>outline-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-width""><code>outline-width</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-ui

value</a></th><td><code>visible</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>Block-containers, flex containers, and grid containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, except with <code>visible</code>/<code>clip</code> computing to <code>auto</code>/<code>hidden</code> respectively if one of <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-x""><code>overflow-x</code></a> or <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-y""><code>overflow-y</code></a> is neither <code>visible</code> nor clip</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>overflow-x: visible;<br>overflow-x: hidden;<br>overflow-x: clip;<br>overflow-x: scroll;<br>overflow-x: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>overflow-x: inherit;<br>overflow-x: initial;<br>overflow-x: revert;<br>overflow-x: revert-layer;<br>overflow-x: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>overflow-x</code> property is specified as a single keyword chosen from the list of values below.</p>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-overflow""><code>text-overflow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/white-space""><code>white-space</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow""><code>overflow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-y""><code>overflow-y</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clip""><code>clip</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-overflow
"Sets what shows when content overflows a block-level element's top and bottom edges"|overflow-y|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-y| This may be nothing, a scroll bar, or the overflow content|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>visible</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>Block-containers, flex containers, and grid containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, except with <code>visible</code>/<code>clip</code> computing to <code>auto</code>/<code>hidden</code> respectively if one of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-x""><code>overflow-x</code></a> or <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-y""><code>overflow-y</code></a> is neither <code>visible</code> nor clip</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>overflow-y: visible;<br>overflow-y: hidden;<br>overflow-y: clip;<br>overflow-y: scroll;<br>overflow-y: auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>overflow-y: inherit;<br>overflow-y: initial;<br>overflow-y: revert;<br>overflow-y: revert-layer;<br>overflow-y: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>overflow-y</code> property is specified as a single keyword chosen from the list of values below.</p><br><p>If <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-x""><code>overflow-x</code></a> is <code>hidden</code>, <code>scroll</code> or <code>auto</code> and this property is <code>visible</code> (default) it will implicitly compute to <code>auto</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li>Related CSS properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-overflow""><code>text-overflow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/white-space""><code>white-space</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow""><code>overflow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow-x""><code>overflow-x</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clip""><code>clip</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/display""><code>display</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-overflow
"Sets what a browser does when reaching the boundary of a scrolling area"|overscroll-behavior|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overscroll-behavior| It's a shorthand for overscroll-behavior-x and overscroll-behavior-y<br>By default, mobile browsers tend to provide a ""bounce"" effect or even a page refresh when the top or bottom of a page (or other scroll area) is reached You may also have noticed that when you have a dialog box with scrolling content on top of a page of scrolling content, once the dialog box's scroll boundary is reached, the underlying page will then start to scroll  this is called scroll chaining<br>In some cases these behaviors are not desirable You can use overscroll-behavior to get rid of unwanted scroll chaining and the browser's Facebook/Twitter app-inspired ""pull to refresh""-type behavior<br>Note that this property only applies to scroll containers In particular, since an <iframe> is not a scroll container, this property cannot be used to stop scroll chaining for iframes|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>non-replaced block-level elements and non-replaced inline-block elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overscroll-behavior-x""><code>overscroll-behavior-x</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overscroll-behavior-y""><code>overscroll-behavior-y</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>overscroll-behavior: auto; /* default */<br>overscroll-behavior: contain;<br>overscroll-behavior: none;<br><br>/* Two values */<br>overscroll-behavior: auto contain;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>overscroll-behavior: inherit;<br>overscroll-behavior: initial;<br>overscroll-behavior: revert;<br>overscroll-behavior: revert-layer;<br>overscroll-behavior: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>overscroll-behavior</code> property is specified as one or two keywords chosen from the list of values below.</p><br><p>Two keywords specifies the <code>overscroll-behavior</code> value on the <code>x</code> and <code>y</code> axes respectively. If only one value is specified, both x and y are assumed to have the same value.</p>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://developer.chrome.com/blog/overscroll-behavior/#demo"" rel=""noopener"">Take control of your scroll: customizing pull-to-refresh and overflow effects</a></li><br></ul>|css-overscroll
"Sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once"|padding|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding|<br>An element's padding area is the space between its content and its border<br>Note: Padding creates extra space within an element In contrast, margin creates extra space around an element|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>: <code>0</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>: the percentage as specified or the absolute length</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Apply to all four sides */<br>padding: 1em;<br><br>/* top and bottom | left and right */<br>padding: 5% 10%;<br><br>/* top | left and right | bottom */<br>padding: 1em 2em 2em;<br><br>/* top | right | bottom | left */<br>padding: 5px 1em 0 2em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>padding: inherit;<br>padding: initial;<br>padding: revert;<br>padding: revert-layer;<br>padding: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>padding</code> property may be specified using one, two, three, or four values. Each value is a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a> or a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage""><code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code></a>. Negative values are invalid.</p><br><ul><br><li>When <strong>one</strong> value is specified, it applies the same padding to <strong>all four sides</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>two</strong> values are specified, the first padding applies to the <strong>top and bottom</strong>, the second to the <strong>left and right</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>three</strong> values are specified, the first padding applies to the <strong>top</strong>, the second to the <strong>right and left</strong>, the third to the <strong>bottom</strong>.</li><br><li>When <strong>four</strong> values are specified, the paddings apply to the <strong>top</strong>, <strong>right</strong>, <strong>bottom</strong>, and <strong>left</strong> in that order (clockwise).</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">Introduction to the CSS basic box model</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a>.</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-start""><code>padding-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-end""><code>padding-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block""><code>padding-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline""><code>padding-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Defines the logical block start and end padding of an element, which maps to physical padding properties depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|padding-block|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and
