numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>padding-block: 10px 20px; /* An absolute length */<br>padding-block: 1em 2em; /* relative to the text size */<br>padding-block: 10px; /* sets both start and end values */<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>padding-block: 5% 2%; /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>padding-block: inherit;<br>padding-block: initial;<br>padding-block: revert;<br>padding-block: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>padding-block</code> property may be specified with one or two values. If one value is given, it is used as the value for both <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-start""><code>padding-block-start</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-end""><code>padding-block-end</code></a>. If two values are given, the first is used for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-start""><code>padding-block-start</code></a> and the second for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-end""><code>padding-block-end</code></a>.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Defines the logical block end padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|padding-block-end|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-end||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>logical-width of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; "Defines the logical block start padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|padding-block-start|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-start||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>logical-width of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt;       /* A length relative to the text size */<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>padding-block-start: 5%;        /* A padding relative to the block container's width */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>padding-block-start: inherit;<br>padding-block-start: initial;<br>padding-block-start: revert;<br>padding-block-start: revert-layer;<br>padding-block-start: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical
"Sets the height of the padding area on the bottom of an element"|padding-bottom|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom|<br>An element's padding area is the space between its content and its border<br><br>Note: The padding property can be used to set paddings on all four sides of an element with a single declaration|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>padding-bottom: 0.5em;<br>padding-bottom: 0;<br>padding-bottom: 2cm;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>padding-bottom: 10%;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>padding-bottom: inherit;<br>padding-bottom: initial;<br>padding-bottom: revert;<br>padding-bottom: revert-layer;<br>padding-bottom: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>padding-bottom</code> property is specified as a single value chosen from the list below. Unlike margins, negative values are not allowed for padding.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">Introduction to the CSS basic box model</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding""><code>padding</code></a> shorthand</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-start""><code>padding-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-end""><code>padding-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block""><code>padding-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline""><code>padding-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Defines the logical inline start and end padding of an element, which maps to physical padding properties depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation"|padding-inline|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a>: <code>0</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a>: <code>0</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>logical-width of containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a>: as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a>: as <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length""><code>&lt;length&gt;</code></a></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>padding-inline: 10px 20px;  /* An absolute length */<br>padding-inline: 1em 2em;   /* relative to the text size */<br>padding-inline: 10px; /* sets both start and end values */<br><br>/* <percentage> values */<br>padding-inline: 5% 2%; /* relative to the nearest block container's width */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>padding-inline: inherit;<br>padding-inline: initial;<br>padding-inline: revert;<br>padding-inline: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>padding-inline</code> property may be specified with one or two values. If one value is given, it is used as the value for both <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a>. If two values are given, the first is used for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a> and the second for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a>.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Logical_Properties"">CSS Logical Properties and Values</a></li><br><li>The mapped physical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top""><code>padding-top</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/direction""><code>direction</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-logical

"Sets the width of the padding area to the left of an element"|padding-left|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left|<br>An element's padding area is the space between its content and its border<br>Note: The padding property can be used to set paddings on all four sides of an element with a single declaration|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code>. "Sets the height of the padding area on the top of an element"|padding-top|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-top|<br>An element's padding area is the space between its content and its border<br><br>Note: The padding property can be used to set paddings on all four sides of an element with a single declaration|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements, except <code>table-row-group</code>, <code>table-header-group</code>, <code>table-footer-group</code>, <code>table-row</code>, <code>table-column-group</code> and <code>table-column</code>. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>padding-top: 0.5em;<br>padding-top: 0;<br>padding-top: 2cm;<br><br>/* <percentage> value */<br>padding-top: 10%;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>padding-top: inherit;<br>padding-top: initial;<br>padding-top: revert;<br>padding-top: revert-layer;<br>padding-top: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>padding-top</code> property is specified as a single value chosen from the list below. Unlike margins, negative values are not allowed for padding.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Model/Introduction_to_the_CSS_box_model"">Introduction to the CSS basic box model</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-right""><code>padding-right</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-bottom""><code>padding-bottom</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-left""><code>padding-left</code></a> and the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding""><code>padding</code></a> shorthand</li><br><li>The mapped logical properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-start""><code>padding-block-start</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block-end""><code>padding-block-end</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-start""><code>padding-inline-start</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline-end""><code>padding-inline-end</code></a> and the shorthands <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-block""><code>padding-block</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/padding-inline""><code>padding-inline</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-box
"Lets you control the order in which the fill and stroke (and painting markers) of text content and shapes are drawn"|paint-order|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/paint-order||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>text elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Normal */<br>paint-order: normal;<br><br>/* Single values */<br>paint-order: stroke; /* draw the stroke first, then fill and markers */<br>paint-order: markers; /* draw the markers first, then fill and stroke */<br><br>/* Multiple values */<br>paint-order: stroke fill; /* draw the stroke first, then the fill, then the markers */<br>paint-order: markers stroke fill; /* draw markers, then stroke, then fill */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>paint-order: inherit;<br>paint-order: initial;<br>paint-order: revert;<br>paint-order: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>If no value is specified, the default paint order is <code>fill</code>, <code>stroke</code>, <code>markers</code>.</p><br><p>When one value is specified, that one is painted first, followed by the other two in their default order relative to one another. When two values are specified, they will be painted in the order they are specified in, followed by the unspecified one.</p><br><div class=""notecard note"" id=""sect1""><br><p><strong>Note:</strong> In the case of this property, markers are only appropriate when drawing SVG shapes involving the use of the <code>marker-*</code> properties (e.g. <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/marker-start""><code>marker-start</code></a>) and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker""><code>&lt;marker&gt;</code></a> element. They do not apply to HTML text, so in that case, you can only determine the order of <code>stroke</code> and <code>fill</code>.</p><br></div>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/almanac/properties/p/paint-order/"" rel=""noopener"">CSS Tricks: paint-order</a></li><br></ul>|svg2-draft
"Determines the distance between the z=0 plane and the user in order to give a 3D-positioned element some perspective"|perspective|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/perspective||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the absolute length or <code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point numbers."">length</a></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Creates <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Positioning/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context"">stacking context</a></th><td>yes</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword value */<br>perspective: none;<br><br>/* <length> values */<br>perspective: 20px;<br>perspective: 3.5em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>perspective: inherit;<br>perspective: initial;<br>perspective: revert;<br>perspective: revert-layer;<br>perspective: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Transforms/Using_CSS_transforms"">Using CSS Transforms</a></li><br></ul>|css-transforms-2

"Allows you to align content along both the block and inline directions at once (i"|place-content|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/place-content|e the align-content and justify-content flex containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>/* align-content does not take left and right values */<br>place-content: center start;<br>place-content: start center;<br>place-content: end left;<br>place-content: flex-start center;<br>place-content: flex-end center;<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>/* justify-content does not take baseline values */<br>place-content: baseline center;<br>place-content: first baseline space-evenly;<br>place-content: last baseline right;<br><br>/* Distributed alignment */<br>place-content: space-between space-evenly;<br>place-content: space-around space-evenly;<br>place-content: space-evenly stretch;<br>place-content: stretch space-evenly;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>place-content: inherit;<br>place-content: initial;<br>place-content: revert;<br>place-content: revert-layer;<br>place-content: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The first value is the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-content""><code>align-content</code></a> property value, the second the <a second value is not present, the first value is used for both, provided it is a valid value for both. If it is invalid for one or the other, the whole value will be invalid.</p><br></div>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Aligning_Items_in_a_Flex_Container"">Aligning items in a flex container</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-content""><code>align-content</code></a> property</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-content""><code>justify-content</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-align

"Allows you to align an individual item in both the block and inline directions at once (i"|place-self|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/place-self|e the align-self and justify-self properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox If the second value is not present, the first value is also used for it|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-self""><code>align-self</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-self""><code>justify-self</code></a>: <code>auto</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>block-level boxes, absolutely-positioned boxes, and grid items</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-self""><code>align-self</code></a>: <code>auto</code> computes to itself on absolutely-positioned elements, and to the computed value of <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items""><code>align-items</code></a> on the parent (minus any legacy keywords) on all other boxes, or <code>start</code> if the box has no parent. Otherwise the specified value.</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-self""><code>justify-self</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>place-self: auto center;<br>place-self: normal start;<br><br>/* Positional alignment */<br>place-self: center normal;<br>place-self: start auto;<br>place-self: end normal;<br>place-self: self-start auto;<br>place-self: self-end normal;<br>place-self: flex-start auto;<br>place-self: flex-end normal;<br>place-self: left auto;<br>place-self: right normal;<br><br>/* Baseline alignment */<br>place-self: baseline normal;<br>place-self: first baseline auto;<br>place-self: last baseline normal;<br>place-self: stretch auto;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>place-self: inherit;<br>place-self: initial;<br>place-self: revert;<br>place-self: revert-layer;<br>place-self: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Basic_Concepts_of_Flexbox"">Basic Concepts of Flexbox</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Flexbox Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Aligning_Items_in_a_Flex_Container"">Aligning items in a flex container</a></em></li><br><li>CSS Grid Guide: <em><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout"">Box alignment in CSS Grid layouts</a></em></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Box_Alignment"">CSS Box Alignment</a></li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-self""><code>align-self</code></a> property</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-self""><code>justify-self</code></a> property</li><br></ul>|css-align
"Sets under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of pointer events"|pointer-events|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/pointer-events||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>pointer-events: auto;<br>pointer-events: none;<br>pointer-events: visiblePainted; /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: visibleFill;    /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: visibleStroke;  /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: visible;        /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: painted;        /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: fill;           /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: stroke;         /* SVG only */<br>pointer-events: all;            /* SVG only */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>pointer-events: inherit;<br>pointer-events: initial;<br>pointer-events: revert;<br>pointer-events: revert-layer;<br>pointer-events: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>pointer-events</code> property is specified as a single keyword chosen from the list of values below.</p>|<ul><br><li>The SVG attribute <code><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/pointer-events"">pointer-events</a></code></li><br><li>The SVG attribute <code><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/visibility"">visibility</a></code></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://webkit.org/specs/PointerEventsProperty.html"" rel=""noopener"">WebKit Specs PointerEventsProperty</a> extended for use in (X)HTML content</li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/user-select""><code>user-select</code></a> - controls whether the user can select text</li><br></ul>|svg2-draft
"Sets how an element is positioned in a document"|position|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position| The top, right, bottom, and left properties determine the final location of positioned elements|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>static</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Creates <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Positioning/Understanding_z_index/The_stacking_context"">stacking context</a></th><td>yes</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>position: static;<br>position: relative;<br>position: absolute;<br>position: fixed;<br>position: sticky;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>position: inherit;<br>position: initial;<br>position: revert;<br>position: revert-layer;<br>position: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Positioning"">Learn CSS: Positioning</a></li><br></ul>|css-position

href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scroll-margin-block-end""><code>scroll-margin-block-end</code></a>: <code>0</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>scroll-margin-block: 10px;<br>scroll-margin-block: 1em 0.5em;<br><br>/* Global values "Defines the margin of the scroll snap area at the end of the block dimension that is used for snapping this box to the snapport"|scroll-margin-block-end|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scroll-margin-block-end| The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container's coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>by computed value type</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <length> values */<br>scroll-margin-block-end: 10px;<br>scroll-margin-block-end: 1em;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>scroll-margin-block-end: inherit;<br>scroll-margin-block-end: initial;<br>scroll-margin-block-end: revert;<br>scroll-margin-block-end: revert-layer;<br>scroll-margin-block-end: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Scroll_Snap"">CSS Scroll Snap</a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://web.dev/css-scroll-snap/"" rel=""noopener"">Well-Controlled Scrolling with CSS Scroll Snap</a></li><br></ul>|css-scroll-snap

"Sets scroll padding on all sides of an element at once, much like the padding property does for padding on an element"|scroll-padding|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scroll-padding|<br>The scroll-padding-* properties define offsets for the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region sidebars), or to put more breathing room between a targeted element and the edges of the scrollport|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a "Sets the color of the scrollbar track and thumb"|scrollbar-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-color|<br>The track refers to the background of the scrollbar, which is generally fixed regardless of the scrolling position<br>The thumb refers to the moving part of the scrollbar, which usually floats on top of the track|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>scrolling boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>scrollbar-color: auto;<br><br>/* <color> values */<br>scrollbar-color: rebeccapurple green; /* Two valid colors.<br>The first applies to the thumb of the scrollbar, the second to the track. */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>scrollbar-color: inherit;<br>scrollbar-color: initial;<br>scrollbar-color: revert;<br>scrollbar-color: revert-layer;<br>scrollbar-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-width""><code>scrollbar-width</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/overflow""><code>overflow</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-scrollbars
"Allows authors to reserve space for the scrollbar, preventing unwanted layout changes as the content grows while also avoiding unnecessary visuals when scrolling isn't needed"|scrollbar-gutter|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-gutter|<br>An element's scrollbar gutter is the space between the inner border edge and the outer padding edge, where the browser may display a scrollbar If no scrollbar is present, the gutter will be painted as an extension of the padding<br>The browser determines whether classic scrollbars or overlay scrollbars are used:<br><br>Classic scrollbars are always placed in a gutter, consuming space when present<br>Overlay scrollbars are placed over the content, not in a gutter, and are usually partially transparent|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>scrolling boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Initial value */<br>scrollbar-gutter: auto;<br><br>/* ""stable"" keyword, with optional modifier */<br>scrollbar-gutter: stable;<br>scrollbar-gutter: stable both-edges;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>scrollbar-gutter: inherit;<br>scrollbar-gutter: initial;<br>scrollbar-gutter: revert;<br>scrollbar-gutter: revert-layer;<br>scrollbar-gutter: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-width""><code>scrollbar-width</code></a></li><br><li><a "Allows the author to set the maximum thickness of an element's scrollbars when they are shown"|scrollbar-width|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-width||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>scrolling boxes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>scrollbar-width: auto;<br>scrollbar-width: thin;<br>scrollbar-width: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>scrollbar-width: inherit;<br>scrollbar-width: initial;<br>scrollbar-width: revert;<br>scrollbar-width: revert-layer;<br>scrollbar-width: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a class=""page-not-created"" title=""The documentation about this has not yet been written; please consider contributing!""><code>-ms-overflow-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::-webkit-scrollbar""><code>::-webkit-scrollbar</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-scrollbars
"Sets the alpha channel threshold used to extract the shape using an image as the value for shape-outside"|shape-image-threshold|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/shape-image-threshold|<br>Any pixels whose alpha component's value is greater than the threshold are considered to be part of the shape for the purposes of determining its boundaries For example, a value of 05 means that the shape will enclose all the pixels that are more than 50% opaque|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0.0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>floats</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>The same as the specified value after clipping the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number""><code>&lt;number&gt;</code></a> to the range [0.0, 1.0].</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;number&gt; "Sets a margin for a CSS shape created using shape-outside"|shape-margin|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/shape-margin|<br>The margin lets you adjust the distance between the edges of the shape (the float element) and the surrounding content|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>floats</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt; "Sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box"|text-align|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-align| This means it works like vertical-align but in the horizontal direction|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial values <code>start</code>, <code>end</code>, <code>left</code>, <code>right</code>, <code>center</code>, <code>justify</code>, <code>justify-all</code>, or <code>match-parent</code>.</li><br><li>Using a <code>&lt;string&gt;</code> value only, in which case the other value defaults to <code>right</code>.</li><br><li>Using both a keyword value and a <a href=""#string""><code>&lt;string&gt;</code></a> value.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/margin""><code>margin: auto</code></a>, <a "Sets the combination of characters into the space of a single character"|text-combine-upright|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-combine-upright| If the combined text is wider than 1em, the user agent must fit the contents within 1em The resulting composition is treated as a single upright glyph for layout and decoration This property only has an effect in vertical writing modes<br>This is used to produce an effect that is known as tate-ch-yoko  in Japanese, or as  in Chinese|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>non-replaced inline elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>specified keyword, plus integer if 'digits'</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>Not animatable</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Keyword values */<br>text-combine-upright: none;<br>text-combine-upright: all;<br><br>/* Digits values */<br>text-combine-upright: digits;     /* fits 2 consecutive digits horizontally inside vertical text */<br>text-combine-upright: digits 4;   /* fits up to 4 consecutive digits horizontally inside vertical text */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>text-combine-upright: inherit;<br>text-combine-upright: initial;<br>text-combine-upright: revert;<br>text-combine-upright: revert-layer;<br>text-combine-upright: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/writing-mode""><code>writing-mode</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-orientation""><code>text-orientation</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-writing-modes
"Sets the appearance of decorative lines on text"|text-decoration|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration| It is a shorthand for text-decoration-line, text-decoration-color, text-decoration-style, and the newer text-decoration-thickness property<br>Text decorations are drawn across descendant text elements This means that if an element specifies a text decoration, then a child element can't remove the decoration For example, in the markup <p>This text has <em>some emphasized words</em> in it</p>, the style rule p { text-decoration: underline; } would cause the entire paragraph to be underlined The style rule em { text-decoration: none; } would not cause any change; the entire paragraph would still be underlined However, the rule em { text-decoration: overline; } would cause a second decoration to appear on ""some emphasized words""|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-style""><code>text-decoration-style</code></a>: <code>solid</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-line""><code>text-decoration-line</code></a>: <code>none</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-line""><code>text-decoration-line</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-style""><code>text-decoration-style</code></a>: as specified</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>: computed color</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-thickness""><code>text-decoration-thickness</code></a>: as specified</li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-style""><code>text-decoration-style</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-line""><code>text-decoration-line</code></a>: discrete</li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-thickness""><code>text-decoration-thickness</code></a>: by computed value type</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>text-decoration: underline;<br>text-decoration: overline red;<br>text-decoration: none;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>text-decoration: inherit;<br>text-decoration: initial;<br>text-decoration: revert;<br>text-decoration: revert-layer;<br>text-decoration: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>text-decoration</code> property is specified as one or more space-separated values representing the various longhand text-decoration properties.</p>|<ul><br><li>The individual text-decoration properties are <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-line""><code>text-decoration-line</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-style""><code>text-decoration-style</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-thickness""><code>text-decoration-thickness</code></a>.</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-skip-ink""><code>text-decoration-skip-ink</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-underline-offset""><code>text-underline-offset</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-underline-position""><code>text-underline-position</code></a> properties also affect text-decoration, but are not included in the shorthand.</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/list-style""><code>list-style</code></a> attribute controls the appearance of items in HTML <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ol""><code>&lt;ol&gt;</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ul""><code>&lt;ul&gt;</code></a> lists.</li><br></ul>|css-text-decor
"Sets the color of decorations added to text by text-decoration-line"|text-decoration-color|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color|<br>The color applies to decorations, such as underlines, overlines, strikethroughs, and wavy lines like those used to mark misspellings, in the scope of the property's value<br>CSS does not provide a direct mechanism for specifying a unique color for each line type This effect can nevertheless be achieved by nesting elements, applying a different line type to each element (with the text-decoration-line property), and specifying the line color (with text-decoration-color) on a per-element basis|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>currentcolor</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>computed color</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* <color> values */<br>text-decoration-color: currentcolor;<br>text-decoration-color: red;<br>text-decoration-color: #00ff00;<br>text-decoration-color: rgba(255, 128, 128, 0.5);<br>text-decoration-color: transparent;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>text-decoration-color: inherit;<br>text-decoration-color: initial;<br>text-decoration-color: revert;<br>text-decoration-color: revert-layer;<br>text-decoration-color: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>When setting multiple line-decoration properties at once, it may be more convenient to use the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration""><code>text-decoration</code></a> shorthand property instead.</li><br><li>The <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value""><code>&lt;color&gt;</code></a> data type</li><br><li>Other color-related properties: <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-color""><code>background-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border-color""><code>border-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color""><code>outline-color</code></a>, <a aria-current=""page"" href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-color""><code>text-emphasis-color</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow""><code>text-shadow</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/caret-color""><code>caret-color</code></a>, and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/column-rule-color""><code>column-rule-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Colors/Applying_color"">Applying color to HTML elements using CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-text-decor
"Sets the kind of decoration that is used on text in an element, such as an underline or overline"|text-decoration-line|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-line|<br>When setting multiple line-decoration properties at once, it may be more convenient to use the text-decoration shorthand property instead|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Single keyword */<br>text-decoration-line: none;<br>text-decoration-line: underline;<br>text-decoration-line: overline;<br>text-decoration-line: line-through;<br>text-decoration-line: blink;<br><br>/* Multiple keywords */<br>text-decoration-line: underline overline;               /* Two decoration lines */<br>text-decoration-line: overline underline line-through;  /* Multiple decoration lines */<br><br>/* Global values */<br>text-decoration-line: inherit;<br>text-decoration-line: initial;<br>text-decoration-line: revert;<br>text-decoration-line: revert-layer;<br>text-decoration-line: unset;<br><br></pre><br><br><p>The <code>text-decoration-line</code> property is specified as <code>none</code>, or <strong>one or more</strong> space-separated values from the list below.</p>|<ul><br><li>When setting multiple line-decoration properties at once, it may be more convenient to use the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration""><code>text-decoration</code></a> shorthand property instead, which also includes:<br>    <ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-style""><code>text-decoration-style</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-color""><code>text-decoration-color</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-thickness""><code>text-decoration-thickness</code></a></li><br></ul><br></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-underline-offset""><code>text-underline-offset</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-text-decor
"Specifies how overlines and underlines are drawn when they pass over glyph ascenders and descenders"|text-decoration-skip-ink|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-skip-ink|<br>text-decoration-skip-ink is not part of the text-decoration shorthand|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Single keyword */<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: none;<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: auto;<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: all;<br><br>/* Global keywords */<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: inherit;<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: initial;<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: revert;<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: revert-layer;<br>text-decoration-skip-ink: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration""><code>text-decoration</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-skip""><code>text-decoration-skip</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-text-decor-4
"Sets the style of the lines specified by text-decoration-line"|text-decoration-style|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-style| The style applies to all lines that are set with text-decoration-line<br>If the specified decoration has a specific semantic meaning, like a line-through line meaning that some text has been deleted, authors are encouraged to denote this meaning using an HTML tag, like <del> or <s> As browsers can disable styling in some cases, the semantic meaning won't disappear in such a situation<br>When setting multiple line-decoration properties at once, it may be more convenient to use the text-decoration shorthand property instead|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>solid</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Sets the stroke thickness of the decoration line that is used on text in an element, such as a line-through, underline, or overline"|text-decoration-thickness|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration-thickness||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. "Applies emphasis marks to text (except spaces and control characters)"|text-emphasis|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis| It is a shorthand for text-emphasis-style and text-emphasis-color<br>The text-emphasis property is quite different from text-decoration The text-decoration property does not inherit, and the decoration specified is applied across the whole element However, text-emphasis does inherit, which means it is possible to change emphasis marks for descendants<br>The size of the emphasis symbol, like ruby symbols, is about 50% of the size of the font, and text-emphasis may affect line height when the current leading is not enough for the marks<br>Note: text-emphasis doesn't reset the value of text-emphasis-position This is because if the style and the color of emphasis marks may vary in a text, it is extremely unlikely that their position will In the very rare cases when this is needed, use the property text-emphasis-position|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td>as each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-style""><code>text-emphasis-style</code></a>: <code>none</code></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-color""><code>text-emphasis-color</code></a>: <code>currentcolor</code></li></ul></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a each of the properties of the shorthand:<br/><ul><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-color""><code>text-emphasis-color</code></a>: a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;color&gt; CSS data type are interpolated on each of their red, green, blue components, each handled as a real, floating-point number. Note that interpolation of colors happens in the alpha-premultiplied sRGBA color space to prevent unexpected grey colors to appear."">color</a></li><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-style""><code>text-emphasis-style</code></a>: discrete</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Initial value */<br>text-emphasis: none; /* No emphasis marks */<br><br>/* <string> value */<br>text-emphasis: ""x"";<br>text-emphasis: """";<br>text-emphasis: ""\25B2"";<br>text-emphasis: ""*"" #555;<br>text-emphasis: ""foo""; /* Should NOT use. "Sets where emphasis marks are drawn"|text-emphasis-position|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-position| Like ruby text, if there isn't enough room for emphasis marks, the line height is increased|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>over right</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Initial value */<br>text-emphasis-position: over right;<br><br>/* Keywords value */<br>text-emphasis-position: over left;<br>text-emphasis-position: under right;<br>text-emphasis-position: under left;<br><br>text-emphasis-position: left over;<br>text-emphasis-position: right under;<br>text-emphasis-position: left under;<br><br>/* Global values */<br>text-emphasis-position: inherit;<br>text-emphasis-position: initial;<br>text-emphasis-position: revert;<br>text-emphasis-position: revert-layer;<br>text-emphasis-position: unset;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li>The longhand properties <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-style""><code>text-emphasis-style</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-color""><code>text-emphasis-color</code></a>, and the corresponding shorthand property <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis""><code>text-emphasis</code></a>.</li><br></ul>|css-text-decor
"Sets the appearance of emphasis marks"|text-emphasis-style|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-emphasis-style| It can also be set, and reset, using the text-emphasis shorthand|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>/* Initial value */<br>text-emphasis-style: none; /* No emphasis marks */<br><br>/* <string> values */<br>text-emphasis-style: ""x"";<br>text-emphasis-style: """";<br>text-emphasis-style: ""\25B2"";<br>text-emphasis-style: ""*"";<br>text-emphasis-style: ""foo""; /* Should NOT be used. "Sets the length of empty space (indentation) that is put before lines of text in a block"|text-indent|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-indent|<br>Horizontal spacing is with respect to the left (or right, for right-to-left layout) edge of the containing block-level element's content box|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>0</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>block containers</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to the width of the containing block</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>the percentage as specified or the absolute length, plus any keywords as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;length&gt;
