"controls the use of language-specific glyphs in a typeface"|font-language-override|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-language-override|<br><br>By default, HTML's lang attribute tells browsers to display glyphs designed specifically for that language For example, a lot of fonts have a special character for the digraph fi that merge the dot on the ""i"" with the ""f"" However, if the language is set to Turkish the typeface will likely know not to use the merged glyph; Turkish has two versions of the ""i,"" one with a dot (i) and one without (), and using the ligature would incorrectly transform a dotted ""i"" into a dotless ""i""<br>The font-language-override property lets you override the typeface behavior for a specific language This is useful, for example, when the typeface you're using lacks proper support for the language For instance, if a typeface doesn't have proper rules for the Azeri language, you can force the font to use Turkish glyphs, which follow similar rules|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>font-language-override =   normal    |  <string>  <br></pre><br><p>The <code>font-language-override</code> property is specified as the keyword <code>normal</code> or a <code>&lt;string&gt;</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant""><code>font-variant</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-position""><code>font-variant-position</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-east-asian""><code>font-variant-east-asian</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps""><code>font-variant-caps</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-ligatures""><code>font-variant-ligatures</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-numeric""><code>font-variant-numeric</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-alternates""><code>font-variant-alternates</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-synthesis""><code>font-synthesis</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-kerning""><code>font-kerning</code></a>.</li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"sets the size of lower-case letters relative to the current font size (which defines the size of upper-case letters)"|font-size-adjust|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size-adjust|<br><br>The property is useful since the legibility of fonts, especially at small sizes, is determined more by the size of lowercase letters than by the size of capital letters Legibility can become an issue when the first-choice font-family is unavailable and its replacement has a significantly different aspect ratio (the ratio of the size of lowercase letters to the size of the font)<br>To use this property in a way that is compatible with browsers that do not support font-size-adjust, it is specified as a number that the font-size property is multiplied by This means the value specified for the property should generally be the aspect ratio of the first choice font For example, consider this style sheet:<br>font-size: 14px;<br>font-size-adjust: 05;<br><br>It is really specifying that the lowercase letters of the font should be 7px high (05  14px) This will still produce reasonable results in browsers that do not support font-size-adjust, where a 14px font will be used|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>none</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>a <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number#interpolation"" title=""Values of the &lt;number&gt; CSS data type are interpolated as real, floating-point, numbers."">number</a></td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>font-size: 14px;<br>font-size-adjust: 0.5;<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size""><code>font-size</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-weight""><code>font-weight</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals"">Fundamental text and font styling</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-face/size-adjust""><code>size-adjust</code></a> descriptor</li><br></ul>|css-fonts-5

and functions listed below, space-separated, in any order.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@font-feature-values""><code>@font-feature-values</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"controls the use of alternate, smaller glyphs that are positioned as superscript or subscript"|font-variant-position|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-position|<br>The glyphs are positioned relative to the baseline of the font, which remains unchanged These glyphs are typically used in <sub> and <sup> elements<br><br>When the usage of these alternate glyphs is activated, if one character in the run doesn't have such a typographically-enhanced glyph, the whole set of characters of the run is rendered using a fallback method, synthesizing these glyphs<br>These alternate glyphs share the same em-box and the same baseline as the rest of the font They are merely graphically enhanced, and have no effect on the line-height and other box characteristics|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>normal</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements. It also applies to <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-letter""><code>::first-letter</code></a> and <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::first-line""><code>::first-line</code></a>.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>font-variant-position =   normal  |  sub     |  super   <br></pre><br><p>The <code>font-variant-position</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-alternates""><code>font-variant-alternates</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-caps""><code>font-variant-caps</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-east-asian""><code>font-variant-east-asian</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-ligatures""><code>font-variant-ligatures</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant-numeric""><code>font-variant-numeric</code></a></li><br></ul>|css-fonts
"specifies whether a punctuation mark should hang at the start or end of a line of text"|hanging-punctuation|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/hanging-punctuation| Hanging punctuation may be placed outside the line box|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>hanging-punctuation =   none                                            |  [ first || [ force-end | allow-end ] || last ]  <br></pre><br><p>The <code>hanging-punctuation</code> property may be specified with one, two, or three space-separated values.</p><br><ul><br><li><strong>One-value</strong> syntax uses any one of the keyword values in the list below.</li><br><li><strong>Two-value</strong> syntax uses one of the following:<br>    <ul><br><li><code>first</code> together with any one of <code>last</code>, <code>allow-end</code>, or <code>force-end</code></li><br><li><code>last</code> together with any one of <code>first</code>, <code>allow-end</code>, or <code>force-end</code></li><br></ul><br></li><br><li><strong>Three-value</strong> syntax uses one of the following:<br>    <ul><br><li><code>first</code>, <code>allow-end</code>, and <code>last</code></li><br><li><code>first</code>, <code>force-end</code>, and <code>last</code></li><br></ul><br></li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-indent""><code>text-indent</code></a></li><br><li><a class=""external"" "sets the initial position, relative to the mask position layer set by mask-origin, for each defined mask image"|mask-position|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-position||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>center</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Percentages</th><td>refer to size of mask painting area minus size of mask layer image (see the text for <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position""><code>background-position</code></a>)</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>Consists of two keywords representing the origin and two offsets from that origin, each given as an absolute length (if given a &lt;length&gt;), otherwise as a percentage.</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>repeatable list of simple list of length, percentage, or calc</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>mask-position =   <position>#  <position> =   [ left | center | right | top | bottom | start | end | <length-percentage> ]  |  [ left | center | right | x-start | x-end | <length-percentage> ] [ top | center | bottom | y-start | y-end | <length-percentage> ]  |  [ center | [ left | right | x-start | x-end ] <length-percentage>? ] && [ center | [ top | bottom | y-start | y-end ] <length-percentage>? ]  |  [ center | [ start | end ] <length-percentage>? ] [ center | [ start | end ] <length-percentage>? ]  <length-percentage> =   <length>      |  <percentage>  <br></pre><br><p>One or more <code>&lt;position&gt;</code> values, separated by commas.</p>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/clipping-masking-css/"" rel=""noopener"">Clipping and Masking in CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"sets how mask images are repeated"|mask-repeat|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-repeat| A mask image can be repeated along the horizontal axis, the vertical axis, both axes, or not repeated at all<br><br>By default, the repeated images are clipped to the size of the element, but they can be scaled to fit (using round) or evenly distributed from end to end (using space)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>repeat</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>Consists of two keywords, one per dimension</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>mask-repeat =   <repeat-style>#  <repeat-style> =   repeat-x                                     |  repeat-y                                     |  [ repeat | space | round | no-repeat ]{1,2}  <br></pre><br><p>One or more <code>&lt;repeat-style&gt;</code> values, separated by commas.</p>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/clipping-masking-css/"" rel=""noopener"">Clipping and Masking in CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-masking
"specifies the sizes of the mask images"|mask-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mask-size| The size of the image can be fully or partially constrained in order to preserve its intrinsic ratio<br><br><br>Note: If the value of this property is not set in a mask shorthand property that is applied to the element after the mask-size CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements; In SVG, it applies to container elements excluding the <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/defs""><code>defs</code></a> element and all graphics elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute lengths</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>repeatable list of simple list of length, percentage, or calc</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>mask-size =   <bg-size>#  <bg-size> =   [ <length-percentage [0,]> | auto ]{1,2}  |  cover                                      |  contain                                    <length-percentage> =   <length>      |  <percentage>  <br></pre><br><p>One or more <code>&lt;bg-size&gt;</code> values, separated by commas.</p><br><p>A <code>&lt;bg-size&gt;</code> can be specified in one of three ways:</p><br><ul><br><li>using the keyword <code>contain</code></li><br><li>using the keyword <code>cover</code></li><br><li>using width and height values</li><br></ul><br><p>To specify a size using width and height, you can supply one or two values:</p><br><ul><br><li>If only one value is given it sets the width, with the height set to <code>auto</code>.</li><br><li>If two values are given, the first sets width and the second sets height.</li><br></ul><br><p>Each value can be a <code>&lt;length&gt;</code>, a <code>&lt;percentage&gt;</code>, or <code>auto</code>.</p>|<ul><br><li><a class=""external"" href=""https://css-tricks.com/clipping-masking-css/"" rel=""noopener"">Clipping and Masking in CSS</a></li><br></ul>|css-masking

"sets how an element's region can be manipulated by a touchscreen user (for example, by zooming features built into the browser)"|touch-action|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/touch-action|<br><br>By default, panning (scrolling) and pinching gestures are handled exclusively by the browser An application using Pointer events will receive a pointercancel event when the browser starts handling a touch gesture By explicitly specifying which gestures should be handled by the browser, an application can supply its own behavior in pointermove and pointerup listeners for the remaining gestures Applications using Touch events disable the browser handling of gestures by calling preventDefault(), but should also use touch-action to ensure the browser knows the intent of the application before any event listeners have been invoked<br>When a gesture is started, the browser intersects the touch-action values of the touched element and its ancestors, up to the one that implements the gesture (in other words, the first containing scrolling element) This means that in practice, touch-action is typically applied only to top-level elements which have some custom behavior, without needing to specify touch-action explicitly on any of that element's descendants<br><br>Note: After a gesture starts, changes to touch-action will not have any impact on the behavior of the current gesture|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements except: non-replaced inline elements, table rows, row groups, table columns, and column groups</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>touch-action =   auto                                                |  none                                                |  [ [ pan-x | pan-left | pan-right ] || [ pan-y | pan-up | pan-down ] || pinch-zoom ]  |  manipulation                                        <br></pre><br><p>The <code>touch-action</code> property may be specified as either:</p><br><ul><br><li>One of the keywords <code>auto</code>, <code>none</code>, <a href=""#manipulation""><code>manipulation</code></a>, <em>or</em></li><br><li>One of the keywords <code>pan-x</code>, <code>pan-left</code>, <code>pan-right</code>, and/or one of the keywords <code>pan-y</code>, <code>pan-up</code>, <code>pan-down</code>, plus optionally the keyword <code>pinch-zoom</code>.</li><br></ul>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/pointer-events""><code>pointer-events</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_events"" title=""Pointer Events""><code>Pointer Events</code></a></li><br><li>WebKit Blog <a class=""external"" href=""https://webkit.org/blog/5610/more-responsive-tapping-on-ios/"" rel=""noopener"">More Responsive Tapping on iOS</a></li><br><li>Google Developers Blog <a class=""external"" href=""https://developer.chrome.com/blog/scrolling-intervention/"" rel=""noopener"">Making touch scrolling fast by default</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Scroll_Snap"">Scroll Snap</a></li><br></ul>|compatibility
"defines the layout box to which the transform, individual transform properties translate,scale, and rotate, and transform-origin properties relate"|transform-box|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-box||<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>view-box</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>transformable elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>transform-box =   content-box  |  border-box   |  fill-box     |  stroke-box   |  view-box     <br></pre><br><p>The <code>transform-box</code> property is specified as one of the keyword values listed below.</p>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Transforms/Using_CSS_transforms"">Using CSS transforms</a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform""><code>transform</code></a>, <a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin""><code>transform-origin</code></a></li><br><li>Individual transform properties:<br>    <ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/translate""><code>translate</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scale""><code>scale</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/rotate""><code>rotate</code></a></li><br></ul><br></li><br></ul>|css-transforms
"sets the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be shown at the top of a page, region, or column"|widows|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/widows|<br><br>In typography, a widow is the last line of a paragraph that appears alone at the top of a page (The paragraph is continued from a prior page)|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>2</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>block container elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>yes</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>widows =   <integer [0,]>  <br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/orphans""><code>orphans</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Paged_Media"">Paged media</a></li><br></ul>|css-break
"hints to browsers how an element is expected to change"|will-change|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/will-change| Browsers may set up optimizations before an element is actually changed These kinds of optimizations can increase the responsiveness of a page by doing potentially expensive work before they are actually required<br><br>Warning: will-change is intended to be used as a last resort, in order to try to deal with existing performance problems It should not be used to anticipate performance problems<br><br><br>Proper usage of this property can be a bit tricky:<br><br>Don't apply will-change to too many elements The browser already tries as hard as it can to optimize everything Some of the stronger optimizations that are likely to be tied to will-change end up using a lot of a machine's resources, and when overused like this can cause the page to slow down or consume a lot of resources<br>Use sparingly The normal behavior for optimizations that the browser make is to remove the optimizations as soon as it can and revert back to normal But adding will-change directly in a stylesheet implies that the targeted elements are always a few moments away from changing and the browser will keep the optimizations for much longer time than it would have otherwise So it is a good practice to switch will-change on and off using script code before and after the change occurs<br>Don't apply will-change to elements to perform premature optimization If your page is performing well, don't add the will-change property to elements just to wring out a little more speed will-change is intended to be used as something of a last resort, in order to try to deal with existing performance problems It should not be used to anticipate performance problems Excessive use of will-change will result in excessive memory use and will cause more complex rendering to occur as the browser attempts to prepare for the possible change This will lead to worse performance<br>Give it sufficient time to work This property is intended as a method for authors to let the user-agent know about properties that are likely to change ahead of time Then the browser can choose to apply any ahead-of-time optimizations required for the property change before the property change actually happens So it is important to give the browser some time to actually do the optimizations Find some way to predict at least slightly ahead of time that something will change, and set will-change then<br>Be aware, that will-change may actually influence the visual appearance of elements, when used with property values, that create a stacking context (eg will-change: opacity), as the stacking context is created up front|<table class=""properties""><tbody><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/initial_value"">Initial value</a></th><td><code>auto</code></td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Applies to</th><td>all elements</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/inheritance"">Inherited</a></th><td>no</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row""><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/computed_value"">Computed value</a></th><td>as specified</td></tr><tr><th scope=""row"">Animation type</th><td>discrete</td></tr></tbody></table>|<pre><br>.slide {<br>  will-change: transform;<br>}<br><br></pre><br>|<ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform""><code>transform</code></a></li><br><li>Individual transform properties:<br>    <ul><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/translate""><code>translate</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scale""><code>scale</code></a></li><br><li><a href=""https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/rotate""><code>rotate</code></a></li><br><li>Note: there is no individual <code>skew</code> property</li><br></ul><br></li><br></ul>|css-will-change
